loans.name: Eshiamboko Group

texts.en:
Regina’s group has 15 farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. Regina is pictured on the right of Eshiamboko Group with her hand raised. Regina is pictured amongst the five men and 10 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting a half acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. 

Regina first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Regina joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Regina described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and send her children to school. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Regina’s group members will take input loans of a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7 1/2 acres of land.   

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Lwanyola Group

texts.en:
Josphat represents the Lwanyola Group, comprised of 10 women and three men located in Kakamega, North District. He is pictured on the right with his hand raised. Josphat is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum cultivation. He first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Josphat joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for his family and use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Josphat reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about nine bags of maize per 3/4 acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 14 bags per 3/4 acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and repair his home. Lwanyola Group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 6 1/2 acres of millet and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultiave millet, sorghum, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Chikaze A Group

texts.en:
Leonard is a member of the Chikaze A Group in Chwele District. He is pictured with 13 One Acre Fund farmers: nine women and four men. Leonard is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for a ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Leonard first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund to gain access to best input prices of hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Leonard described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Chikaze A Group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, the group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer to cultivate sweet potato, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Hector Giovany

texts.es:
“Algunos dicen que tatuarse es una aberración contra las normas morales, pero estoy convencido que el arte también puede llevarse en la piel”  Estas son las palabras de Héctor un joven de 30 años de edad, quien aprendió a elaborar tatuajes en Lima, Perú y posteriormente decidió devolverse para su país y radicarse en su municipio, Itagüí, Colombia. 
Desde su llegada comenzó a laborar en su domicilio, realizando tatuajes a sus amigos y conocidos. Con el tiempo sus clientes comenzaron aumentar, lo que dio lugar a montar su negocio en un local. Hoy no sólo se dedica a la elaboración de tatuajes si no que combina la actividad con la comercialización de prendas de vestir, lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de tinta, camisetas y accesorios. Espera que su negocio siga creciendo y posicionar su nombre en toda la localidad.
texts.en:
“Some say that tattoos are an aberration against morality, but I am convinced that art can also be on skin". These are the words of Héctor, a 30 year old man who learned to make tattoos in Lima, Peru. Later he decided to return to his country and live in his town of Itagüí, Colombia.
 
When he arrived, he started to work from his home, making tattoos for his friends and acquaintances. Over time, his customers started to grow, and that resulted in him opening a locale. Today he not only makes tattoos, but he combines that activity with selling clothing, which has allowed him to improve his income.   

Right now, he is asking for a loan to be used for buying ink, t-shirts and accessories. He hopes for his business to keep growing and to have his name known throughout the community.

loans.use: to buy ink, t-shirts and accessories.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 40-year-old single woman. For the past seven years, she has been selling cotton clothing, lingerie, pajamas, and blankets. Wisam is a hard worker who continuously improves her business. She proves to others that she is capable of handling any obstacle she might face, both in running her business and in her personal life. Wisam has introduced her customers to different items and has become an expert in meeting customer requests.

Wisam is requesting her forth loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase clothing to increase her spring and summer collections. She used her previous loans to expand her bridal lingerie and underwear selections. In the future, Wisam hopes to open a large specialized wedding dress shop.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to increase her spring and summer collections

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 32 años y es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, por los cuales lucha para garantizarles una vivienda digna y una buena educación. Su mayor dificultad es su situación económica, cada día debe buscar el pan para darle de comer a sus hijos y con qué pagar el arriendo de su vivienda. 
Careció de educación debido a la falta de oportunidades. Aunque su vida ha estado marcada por una difícil condición económica esta mujer nunca ha dejado de esforzarse por ofrecerle a su familia un mejor mañana.  Se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de empanadas, arepas con carne y refrescos con el propósito de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Su mayor deseo es poder mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comida rápidas con el fin de ubicar su puesto de trabajo en un lugar más central y mejorar  las ventas.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 32, has three minor children.  She struggles every day in order to assure that they have a decent home and a good education.  Her greatest difficulty is her financial situation.  Every day she needs to look to make ends meet in order to feed her children and pay the rent on her home.

She did not get an education because of the lack of opportunities.  Even though her life has been marked by a difficult financial situation, this woman has never stopped putting forth great effort in order to give her family a better tomorrow.  She has been making and selling empanadas, ‘arepas con carne’ [typical Colombian pancake-like item with meat], and soft drinks in order to generate the income needed to support her household.

Her greatest wish is to improve the quality of her life.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a fast food cart.  She will do this in order to place her work stand in a more central place and improve sales.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 26 years old and married to Ann, who also contributes to the family income. For the past six  years, he has been running a transportation business and earns an income of about 40,000 KES each month. 

Boniface is requesting his first loan through KADET LTD to service his motorbike and buy airtime cards to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to service his motorbike and buy airtime cards to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has a butcher shop and a meat supply business in Tala. She supplies meat to several other butcher shops, as well as to hotels, restaurants, and schools in the area. She is 41 years old and the single mother of three children. She has been in this business for the past five years, and it has been profitable.
This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the amount to buy more meat to sell and to supply to her customers. Because the demand for meat has been increasing day by day, she anticipates making more profits. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.
Joyce hopes to grow her business and to open another butcher shop and meat supply business to make more income and to be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 36-year-old hairdresser. She has been in this business for the past eight years and is doing very well.
 
She joined ID Ghana in 2012 through another beneficiary of the credit scheme. She is a very dedicated individual and hardworking. She has since taken one loan from ID and has been able to repay it without any default. 

She is applying for her second loan and needs 700 Ghana Cedis to buy more creams/wigs to sell to her customers in the Zone 6 community in Dansoman.

loans.use: To buy more creams/wigs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.en:
Jairus’s group has 13 farmers and is located in Chwele. Jairus is pictured on the right of Safina Group with his hand raised. Jairus is pictured with the four other men and eight women of his group. He will receive loans capable of planting 1/2 an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. Jairus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jairus joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to learn new farming techniques.
Jairus described his harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Jairus’s group members will take input loans of 1/2 acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.
The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of four children. A year ago, Carol opened a general store where she sells household appliances, accessories, and beauty cosmetics — anything that a woman might need to help her husband in making their living and covering their family's expenses.

Carol is a hard worker; she was capable of attracting customers' attention through the diversity of products shown to be sold.

Carol is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business capital with a collection of special new accessories, beauty cosmetics and hair colors. This loan will reflect positively on both her social and financial sectors. 

She hopes that she can keep expand her business to better serve her customers.

loans.use: To increase her business capital with a collection of special new accessories, beauty cosmetics and hair colors.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 45-year-old woman. She belongs to the Core group located in Dansoman. She sells underwear. She joined ID in 2009.

She has been trading for the past 10 years. She gets her products from the market and sells them to her customers in and around Dansoman. She is very dedicated to her customers.

This is her eighth loan, and she needs an amount of 500 GHS (Ghana Cedis) to expand her business by buying more underwear to sell.

loans.use: To buy more underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jaribu A Group

texts.en:
Mable is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Jaribu A Group members. The 15 of them, 12 women and three men, are farmers in Kakamega North District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum. Mable joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009 season, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Mable joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Mable was only able to harvest six bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 12 bags per acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mable’s group members will take input loans of half an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Dixon Odera

texts.en:
Dixon has a welding garage, a business he has been doing for the past seven years. Since he joined KADET LTD., he has been impressed with services they offer, and because of that, he has a strong hope in them. He makes a monthly income of 25,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

He is applying for his third loan, which he will use to buy raw materials like iron bars, welding rods and wire mesh. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business into a larger one.

He has a dream of expanding his business and educating all of his children up to a higher level to enable them to become responsible people in the future.

loans.use: to buy iron  bars, welding rods and wire mesh  for welding.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 20-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be a jovial, focused and determined woman. She operates a beauty salon, where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within an urban area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to pay for her school fees. Her business goal is to run a retail store selling beauty products within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 42-year-old woman. She belongs to Yesu Tease group located in the Palace area of Dansoman. She sells sweet pies (pastries). She joined ID in 2012.
Alice has been trading for the past two years. She gets her products from Makola and sells them to her customers in and around Dansoman. She is very dedicated to her customers.
This is Alice’s second loan, and she needs 300 GHS to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yogah

texts.en:
Yogah is a 34-year-old man from Suna Migori in Migori county, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Leah and they have three children aged eight, five and one respectively.

Yogah supports his family by selling second hand clothing, a business that he has been doing for 11 years. He makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) and is applying for his fifth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more bails of second hand clothes to sell. He plans to use his anticipated profits to expand the business. Yogah has hopes that in the future he will be able to grow his business into a wholesale one.

loans.use: to purchase bails of second hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Martun

texts.en:
Martun is 62 years old and lives with his wife, son, and daughter-in-law in Vanadzor City. He has the title of docent of chemical science and works in Vanadzor State Pedagogical University as a lecturer-scientist. He has written many scientific articles, monographs, reports, theses, and methodical works. But as science in Armenia was in crisis after the Soviet Union's collapse, scientists got very low salaries, and there was no opportunity to do research, Martun faced lots of difficulties, like many Armenian scientists. He couldn't maintain his family's living standard or posture. So creating his own business was the only way for Martun to overcome that hard period.
  
He built a small shop in his garden and started to sell vegetables and fruits at first. This deal was successful, and soon Martun enlarged his assortment of products (confectionery products, dairy products, spices, candies, nonalcoholic drinks, oil, meat, etc.). Now his business is going very well and Martun is able to meet his family's needs. Martun’s son helps him greatly in this occupation.

Martun needs 1,000,000 Armenian drams to add inventory. He intends to give his food market business to his son and fully involve himself in science, as he says that science is his main vocation.

loans.use: to add to his inventory of food products

loans.name: Sirende Group

texts.en:
Irene is pictured on the right with her hand raised among her Sirende Group members. The twelve of them, six women and six men, are farmers in Chwele District. Farming supplies will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant 1/2 acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Irene joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012 season and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Irene joined One Acre Fund to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to grow enough food for the family.
Irene reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 6 bags of maize per 3/4 acre, but with her One Acre Fund loan during the Long Rains 2012 season, she harvested 6 1/2 bags per 1/2 acre. She plans to use future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive 1/2 an acre of agricultural supplies on credit. Irene’s group will receive 6 acres worth of supplies on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mounira

texts.en:
Mounira is a 31-year-old single woman who has been working hard for 10 years in mixing and creating special perfume blends. Her business is widely known in her region and highly requested. At the same time, she is investing a good part of her time in creating new odors that attract the attention of new customers.

Mounira also sells hookah pipes, which are in demand these days and generate good income.

This is Mounira's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan helped her a great deal to increase her selection of perfumes with new collections and bottles.

Her current loan will be invested in supporting her hookah business with newly-released products that will attract new customers.

loans.use: To increase her hookah collection with newly- released items

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is 47 years old. He lives in Bolnisi District with his 33-year-old wife, father in-law, and brother in-law. Arif requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family's business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The main income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land where fruits and vegetables are grown (potatoes, maize, haricot, and different kinds of fruit). Harvested products are sold at the market in Bolnisi, and the family gets a small monthly income which is not enough to satisfy their daily needs.

Arif requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Arif will purchase a car. He wants to start trading fruits and vegetables in nearby villages. This will significantly increase their profits. Arif will use part of the profit for reinvesting in the same business and another part to renovate their house, to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Munh-Amgalan

texts.en: Mr. Munh-Amgalan is 35 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in a house in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife, Enhsaihan, age 33, runs a small retail store in a local market. His daughter, Azjargal, age 7, and son, Barhas, age 3, go to a local primary school and kindergarten. The borrower has been running a taxi service business in town for 4 months now and need a loan of 500,000 MNT to replace tires and purchase some spare parts to install in his car. He is a hardworking, diligent, and honest man.

loans.use: to replace tires and purchase some spare parts to install in his car

loans.name: Akrm

texts.en: Akrm is 21 years old. He is a single man, living in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a butcher, who works hard during the whole day. He has been in business for one year. Successfully, he started his business by purchasing goats and sheep with help from his dad who encouraged him to depend on himself. This purchase enabled him to open his small butcher shop. Now, he is looking to expand his business selling his products. His aspiration is to provide for his family. So, he requested a youth loan of 350,000 YER from AMB to buy livestock for his butcher shop to expand his business. In the future, he would like to have a farm of sheep and cows to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock for his butcher shop to expand his business.

loans.name: Perez

texts.en: Perez is a 30-year-old married mother with three children aged from three to fourteen years. She describes herself as a trustworthy and reliable woman. For three years, she has been operating a grocery store where she sells vegetables and cereals such as cabbages, onions, kale, beans and maize. Her business is located within a busy market. Perez describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient stock to sell and she will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to purchase vegetables and cereals. Her business goal is to be running a stable grocery store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and cereals to sell

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agnes is a 34-year-old pastry seller. She is an individual member of the group who meets on Wednesdays. She is married to Richard, a 35-year-old trader. She resides in the Dansoman community.

She has been doing this business for the past 4 years. She gets her goods from the Makola Market in large quantities and in turn sells to her customers. She is very dedicated, industrious, and hardworking.

This is her 1st loan, and she is requesting an amount of GHS 400 to help her buy flour, sugar, and margarine and prepare pastries to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and margarine and prepare pastries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling slippers in Aburansa (near Cape Coast), Ghana. She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Esi is married with six children and her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of slippers. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest her future profits into her business, thus helping it to expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her stock of slippers to sell

loans.name: Siprosa

texts.en: Siprosa is a 51-year-old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 9 to 23 years. She describes herself to be an innovative woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food. Her business is located within a busy market, and her primary customers are urban dwellers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate food for selling. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to run a restaurant within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet ,sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is a 62-year-old retired woman. She is a widow and lives alone in Lagodekhi district. Natela requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Natela is a tailor. She sews quilts and mattresses from her house. Natela is very experienced in this field and she has a good number of clients. Her total monthly income is about 400 Gel, which is hardly enough to pay all the expenses.

Natela requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Natela will purchase chicks and chickens. She will sell the eggs and later, when the chicks are grown, sell them as chickens for a profit. The new poultry business will significantly grow Natela’s monthly income, and she will be able to put up with all the expenses and satisfy her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Pockson

texts.en: Pockson is both a farmer and a driver in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). He has been educated until the end of middle school. He is married and has four children. His wife sells Kenkey for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves). Pockson has been balancing two jobs for five years now. He is responsible for supporting his wife in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. His loan will be used to purchase more fertilizer and fuel, guaranteeing him a higher yield as well as more passengers. He hopes to use the new profits to subsequently grow both his enterprises and increase his capital base. In the long run he especially wants to expand his reach into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer and fuel, guaranteeing him a higher yield as well as more passengers

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen (with his child in the picture) is a 39-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from two years to eleven years. He describes himself to be an honest and ambitious man. He operates a retail business where he sells fish. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase fish to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi grew up in poverty, yet this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells frozen foods in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began, just 6 months ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children.

Esi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her products. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Therefore, she aims to use her loan to purchase more frozen foods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend, by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Lurare Group

texts.en:
Lurare Group is located in Chwele District. It is a group of 10 women and 2 men, led by Caro, who is on the right side of the picture, with her hand raised. She is receiving an agricultural input loan, which will include all necessary materials for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Caro first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Caro joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Caro described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, the Lurare Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on six acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious, determined, and confident. She does farming where she sells bananas. Her business is located at a potential business area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances for expanding the business. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to purchase construction materials for a septic toilet that will be used by her tenants. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more septic toilets. Lilian also runs rental houses where she provides accommodation services. Sometimes, she also sells cereal which adds to her business income.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a septic toilet that will be used by her tenants

loans.name: Bumsika Group

texts.en:
Clement’s group has 5 farmers and is located in Teso District. Clement is pictured on the right of Bumsika Group with his hand raised. Clement is pictured amongst the 1 man and 4 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. Clement first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Clement joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Clement reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 8 bags per 1/2 acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to buy a cow and send his children to school. Clement’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 2 1/2 acres of millet and sorghum.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy kitchen spices an other items.

loans.name: Kenedy

texts.en: Kenedy is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children ages four years and six years. He describes himself to be an honest and ambitious man. He operates a bicycle where he provides transportation services. His business is located within urban area and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition from motorcycles. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for his transportation business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 60-year-old married woman, who has been working as a tailor for the past 39 years. In 1992, Mariam opened her own business, to develop her business and increase her income. 
Mariam is specialized in tailoring clothes and table blankets and shields in a very creative way.
Her long experience provides her with customers' trust and support.
She is applying for her eighth cycle loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a glass display for her shop and newly-released fabrics that will help her be more creative for new designs.
She hopes to be capable of moving her shop to another region that is more flexible and relaxing to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a glass display for her shop and newly-released fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet ,sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a single man. He describes himself as a humble and honest man. He operates a store where he sells phone accessories. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a potential business area, and his primary customers are nearby residents.

Julius says his biggest business challenge is lack of finances for expanding the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase phone accessories to resell. His business goal is to expand the business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to resell at his store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and married to Muoki. They have three children, between the ages of 18 and 8 years. Mary has been running her retail shop for a period of about 10 years, earning an income of KES 15,000 a month.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD, after having repaid successfully the previous one. She wants to buy stock of wheat flour, rice and sugar, to resell in her store. 

She hopes to help her children to be independent, and to expand her business to a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat flour, rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Ukulima Bora Group

texts.en:
Martin is a member of Ukulima Bora Group in Teso District. The group is comprised of six One Acre Fund farmers, four women and two men. Martin is standing on the right side of the picture, with his hand raised. He is receiving an agricultural input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Martin joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Martin joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest four bags of maize per acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 11 bags per ½ acre! He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and to buy a cow. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. In total, Ukulima Bora Group will receive three acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

(The field officer is standing on the left side of the photo.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes as a petty trader in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Ama is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Ama will use the loan to purchase larger amounts of general provisions, which will aid her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of general provisions, which will aid her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Juddy

texts.en:
Juddy is a 38-year-old, married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as a patient and warm woman. She operates a general store, where she sells items such as sugar, salt, cooking fat, pain killers, tissues, and the like. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a residential area, and her primary customers are nearby residents. She says her biggest business challenge is stiff competition within the area.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase more inventory to sell, like sugar, salt, cooking fat, and tissues. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She managed to repay a previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell in her general store, like sugar, salt, cooking fat, and tissues

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam tiene la edad de 35 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unos pollos para engorde. Ella desea comprar estos animales y además el concentrado para su alimentación, para poder  engordarlos y venderlos en lugares aledaños y en las pulperías y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Miriam is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children. She wants the loan in order to buy some chickens to fatten up. She wants to buy these animals and feed for them, in order to be able to fatten them and sell them in the neighborhood and in local convenience stores, and in that way have increased income. 

In the future she hopes to give her family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to be able to continue growing as a person. This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given the loan to her in a more straightforward manner and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Bidii Group has 11 farmers, 8 women and 3 men, and is located in Teso District. Group member Jephter is pictured on the right of Bidii Group, with his hand raised. He will receive an agricultural input loan capable of planting ½ acre of land with sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Jephter’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to access the best input prices, and to use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Jephter described his harvest last year as poor. He hopes that, as a One Acre Fund farmer, he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school, and to eradicate vermin in his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. In total, Bidii Group will receive 5.5 acres' worth of inputs on credit.

(The field officer is standing on the left side of the photo.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Faustina Yaayaa

texts.en:
Faustina is a widow and has one child. Having successfully graduated from junior high school, Faustina is now an established businesswoman. She sells maize in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about nine years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Faustina uses her income to provide for the family.

Faustina will use the loan to purchase larger amounts of maize, which will aid her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustina plans to diversify the types of products that she sells, adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of maize

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as a trustworthy man. He operates a food stall and butcher shop, where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located at a residential area, and his primary customers are nearby residents. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the business.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to purchase meat to sell. His business goal is to run more, similar outlets, within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell

loans.name: Terem Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of Terem Group, in Chwele District. He is one of the group's 16 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 9 men. Joseph is standing on the right side of the picture, with his hand raised. He is receiving an agricultural input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Joseph first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Joseph joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to benefit from the best input prices, which One Acre Fund offers.

Joseph reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 10 bags per 1/2 acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, the Terem Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on eight acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Tumaini is a group of 18 farmers in the Teso District represented by Sabensia. The group has 5 women and 13 men. Sabensia is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a ½ acre of millet, sorghum, and sweet potatoes. Sabensia is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and access the best input prices.

Sabensia managed to harvest 15 bags of maize on 3 acres of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, she hopes to harvest even more! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. Sabensia’s group members will each receive input loans of a ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 9 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline is a 28-year-old single businesswoman with one child. She has been running her mobile transfer business for a period of about 6 years with an income of approximately KES 11,000 a month.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. and she wants to use the money to add more float on her mobile money transfer business. She hopes to open more money transfer shops and give her child a quality education.

loans.use: to add float on her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Ngeibach Group

texts.en:
Roselyne’s group has 4 farmers and is located in the Teso District. Roselyne is pictured on the right of the Ngeibach Group with her hand raised. Roselyne is pictured amongst the 1 man and 3 women of her group. The field officer is standing on the left of the photo. She will receive input loans capable of planting a ½ an acre with millet, sorghum, and sweet potatoes. Roselyne first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Roselyne described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. Roselyne’s group members will each receive input loans of a ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 2 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy laying hens.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children between the ages of one and five, and describes herself as visionary and ambitious. 

Fatuma operates a beauty salon where she provides hair services. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located near a slum, and her primary customers are residents from the slum. Fatuma's greatest business challenge is obtaining the funds necessary for expanding her business. 

Fatuma will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase beauty products for her salon. Her goal is to expand the beauty salon within the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Fateh

texts.en:
For five years Fateh, a 23-year-old married father of one living in Sana`a, Yemen, has been operating a grocery store which he started with support from his mother. As his clientele has grown, Fateh has added a greater variety of of merchandise, and his sales have increased. Today his business has a faithful clientele that refers new customers to him.

Fateh is requesting a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to purchase greater quantities of soft drinks, food, mineral water, etc. These items have a fast turnover, and the resulting profits will enable him to expand his enterprise.

Fateh would like to offer his family a good life and send his child to private school.

loans.use: to buy greater quantities of soft drinks, food, mineral water, etc. for his business

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a married woman. She has seven children, with ages ranging from 12 to 33 years. She describes herself as a customer friendly and hard-working woman. She operates a retail store, where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are other businesspeople. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate funds for expanding her business.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to purchase clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM, after having managed to repay a previous loan of KES 50,000, successfully.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene la edad de 43 años, es casada y tiene seis hijos. Ella el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a ella y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que María se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. Ella espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old, married, and has six children. 

She wants a loan to buy livestock in order to sell them when they are grown for profit. The livestock business helps her and her family to get ahead. 

It is the first time that María has borrowed through Fudecosur. She says that the credit committee has helped her a lot and has provided many amenities. She hopes that through the project she grows and achieves her goals so that in the future she can give her family a better quality of life and better financial stability.

This is the first loan she has received from Fodecosure. She has not had previous loans through state banks, but Fudecosure has provided a loan that was more feasible and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy livestock to provide for her family.

loans.name: Valentim

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operador de máquinas numa empresa de fabrico de bananas e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, janelas, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é manter-se saudável para trabalhar mais e superar as dificuldades financeiras.
texts.en:
Married and a father to two children attending school, Valentim lives in his own home and does not support anyone else.  
He is a machine operator for a banana manufacturing company.  He plans to buy construction materials (such as cement, iron, windows and similar) with this loan in order to continue the work on his home.
In the future, he wants to complete his home and build a business, for this he is committed to repay the Hluvuku loan in order to take on further loans.  
His challenge is to stay healthy and work harder to overcome his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, iron, windows and more) to continue the work on his house.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa grew up in poverty without an education, but this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. 

Currently, Adwoa is an entrepreneur, working as a fishmonger and selling palm oil in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Adwoa has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for both of her products. Unfortunately, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. She will use her loan to purchase more fish and palm oil to sell. With the additional profits from her expanded business, Adwoa hopes to buck the trend by ensuring that all of her children will be given the opportunity to further distance themselves from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carpentry machinery in order to make furniture to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten up.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is 36 years old and comes from Kisumu City. He is married and has been blessed with three children, ages 14, 8 and 6 years. He has a retail shop, a business he has been doing for the past 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000.

Jack is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase more goods, in bulk, from the suppliers, like sugar, cooking oil, washing bar soap, and flour. He will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees and to increase his stock. He has a dream of expanding his business into a large one.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in his shop, like sugar, cooking oil, washing bar soap, and flour

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is married and has three children; he owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. For the past two years, he has been working in a transportation business, using a motorcycle (bodaboda) to earn a living. In addition to that, he does farming.

He has requested a loan of KES 20,000. He will use it to buy spare parts for his motorbike, so that he can continue with the business efficiently.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene la edad de 46 años, es casado. El el crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de engorde y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a él y a su familia a salir adelante. Es la primera vez que José se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le ha brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José, married, is 46 years old.

He wants a loan in order to buy livestock to fatten and when they are larger sell them at a profit. The livestock business will help him and his family to get ahead.

It is the first time that José has financed through Fudecosure, saying that the committee has helped a lot by providing many amenities. He hopes that through this project he grows and reaches his goals so he can in the future give his family a better quality of life and improved financial stability.

This is the first loan he has received from Fodecosure. He has not had previous loans through state banks, but Fudecosure has provided a loan that was more feasible and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy livestock to fatten and sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 61 year-old married woman. She has nine children whose ages range from 7 to 27 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a general store where she sells plastic items such jugs, cups, etc. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located within a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase plastic items to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase plastic items to sell

loans.name: Eco Seven Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 44 year-old Christine from Masvingo. She is widowed and has three children.  Christine runs an agriculture business selling chickens . The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges faced are dealing with some bogus sellers who sell chicks which are not of good quality.  Christine has requested a loan of $400 to buy chicks and stock feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will increase her household income and improve the family welfare. In the future, Christine plans to increase the number of chickens she keeps.

loans.use: to buy stock feed and chicks

loans.name: Scholastika

texts.en:
Scholastika is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as an ambitious and industrious woman. She operates a food stall, where she sells prepared foods. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located within a busy area. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital to buy food for selling.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase food ingredients, for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to run a restaurant, within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 35 year-old single woman. She has two children whose ages range from six years to ten years. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as onions, tomatoes, bananas, cabbages, etc. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a busy shopping center and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Mavuno Group is located in Teso District. It is a group of 6 women and 14 men led by Jafred pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Jafred first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Jafred joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Jafred described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. Jafred’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 10 acres of millet and sorghum. 

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Khwiroro Group

texts.en:
Khwiroro Group is located in Chwele District.  It is a group of 6 women and 4 men led by James, pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. James first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2008 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. James joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

James reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about three bags of maize per 3 1/4 acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested eight bags per 1/2 acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a cow. For the 2013 Long Rains season, James’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Zvido Zvavanhu Magwari Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 65 year old Alice from Masvingo. She is widowed and has seven children.  Alice runs a poultry business. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenge she faces is of chicks dying prematurely. Alice has requested a loan of $300 to buy chicks and stock feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will go towards her family upkeep. In the future, Alice plans to increase the number of chickens she keeps.

loans.use: to buy chicks and stock feed

loans.name: Tozagul

texts.ru: Трудное условие жизни заставляет человека направлять все свои усилия и мотивировать существующие ресурсы. Тозагул является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети Юсуф и Оиша совершеннолетние. Ее муж работает в фермерском хозяйстве, и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Тозагул решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур как картошка, лук и морковь, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1475 долларов США для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Difficult conditions in life force a person to focus all their strength and motivation to making the most of existing resources.  Tozagul is just such a person.  She tries to improve her quality of life and to stimulate the economic growth of her family.  She is married and raised 2 children, Josef and Oisha, who are now adults.  Her husband works as a farmer and receives very little compensation.  His income is not enough to provide the family with all necessities.  Tozagul decided to help her husband for her family's sake.  With this goal, she took the course "To Get Ahead" offered by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate of completion.  Now, she is able to organize her own business and become successful.  She wants to start a garden where she will grow potatoes, onions and carrots since she has experience doing so.  With the income she'll receive, she plans to improve her living conditions.  She is asking for a loan of $1475 to buy fertilizers which will help her start.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds for organizing new business

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza, with her husband and four young children, lives in a rural village of southern Albania. People in this village and other villages around have been living under extreme poverty throughout these past twenty two years after the collapse of the communist regime. And for unknown reasons, efforts from international development agencies have been limited in the areas as well.
Mimoza has been in the livestock business for the past five years, yet the earnings from this haven’t been that great because she only has two cows. Now that one of her neighbors is going to live abroad, they are selling their animals, and Mimoza wants to buy a dairy cow from them at a lower price.  increase the milk produce and eventually the earnings.
Mimoza is photographed here with two of her sons.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow from her neighbours

loans.name: Angongong Group

texts.en:
Saidi is a member of Angongong Group in Teso District. He is pictured with nine One Acre Fund farmers, six women and three men. Saidi is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Saidi first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Saidi joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Saidi described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Saidi’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 4 1/2 acres of land.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.ru: Лейла прекрасная женщина с новыми идеями. Ей 32 года. У этой прекрасной молодой женщины трудная судьба, так как ее муж умер, и она осталась с 3 детьми без кормильца. От мужа ей осталась 1,5 га земли, где можно выращивать зерно и можно развивать садоводство. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур. Она нуждается в источнике дохода. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Ее свекровь будет помогать ей ведение бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ для покупки минерального удобрения и семена, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Leyla is a lovely women with new ideas.  She is 32 years old.  This wonderful, young woman as had a difficult life since her husband died and she was left alone with 3 children without a provider.  Her husband left her 1.5 hectares of land where you can grow corn and develop other crops.  She wants to start her own agriculture business.  She needs a source of income.  With this goal, she took the course "To Get Ahead" offered by the Women's Business Association and received a certificate of completion.  Now, she is able to start the business and to be successful.  Her mother-in-law will help her run everything.  She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds to get started.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира очень благодарна всем тем кто поддержал её. Доходы от первого кредита позволили улучшить благосостояние семьи очень хорошо. В этот раз Элмира обращается к фонду Кива за кредитом в размере 100,000 KGS на приобретение овец и коров.Доходы от кредита намерена направит на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Elmira is very grateful for all those who have supported her.  The income from her first loan allowed her to improve the welfare of her family.  This time, Elmira is asking Kiva for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase sheep and cows.  The income from this home will be used to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: God Bless Us Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39 year old Mildred from Masvingo. She is a widow and has four children, three attending school.  Mildred sells maize for a living. The business has been in operation for one year. The challenge she faces in her business is the shortage of suppliers of maize. Mildred has requested a loan of $200 to buy maize for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her income and enable her to provide for her family's food and school fees. In the future, Mildred plans to own a shop and be an employer.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Tasvunura Magwari Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 57 year-old Tsitsi, from Masvingo. She is widowed and has five children. She also cares for five dependents. Her business entails selling chickens and goats. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are of a low market for the goats. Tsitsi has requested a loan of $200 to buy chicks and stock feed. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to provide for her household. In the future, Tsitsi plans to expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy chicks and stock feed

loans.name: Katamakisi Group

texts.en:
Benjamin’s group has ten farmers and is located in Teso District. Benjamin is pictured on the right of Katamakisi Group with his hand raised. Benjamin is pictured amongst the six men and four women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre of sorghum, millet, and sweet potatoes. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Benjamin’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Benjamin described his harvest last year as poor. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he is able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to buy a goat and send his children to school. Benjamin’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for five acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Ogultach

texts.ru: Огултач 44 года. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она живет бедно и ей очень трудно обеспечить 4 детей одной. Она работает медсестрой в больнице и получает маленькую зарплату. Ей срочно надо найти дополнительный источник дохода, так как дети растут, а вмести сними их расходы. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес услуги швеи, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ogultach is 44 years old, a widow, and has four children.  She lives in poverty and it's very difficult for her to provide for four children alone.  She works as a nurse as a hospital--a position that doesn't pay well.  She urgently needs to find a source of additional income since her growing children have growing expenses.  With this goal, she has taken the course "To Get Ahead" offered by the Women's Business Association and received a certificate of completion.  Now, she is able to begin her own business and become successful at it.  She wants to organize a sewing business since she has a lot of experience in this area.  With the new income, she plans to pay for her children's education and to provide them with high-quality foods.  She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine to help get her started.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine

loans.name: Sossi

texts.en:
Sossi is a 56-year-old married woman and mother of three children.  She has been working as a tailor since 1984. Her long experience earned her customers' trust and support, and helped her a lot in expanding her business.
Sossi is applying for her tenth cycle loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her son's university fees.
Her previous loans helped a lot in expanding and widening her business, through adding newly-developed machines that are capable of responding to almost all of her customers' needs. Her husband helps her with part of her business, but Sossi handles most business issues. She hopes that she stays capable of providing her children with the things they need.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university fees

loans.name: Ambana Group

texts.en:
Silas, a member of Ambana Group in Chwele District, is pictured standing on the right with his hand raised with 14 One Acre Fund farmers consisting of eight women and six men. Silas is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. He joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2008, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. He joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Silas was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize per 2½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 22 bags per 1½ acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to buy land for family use. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Silas’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on seven acres of land.

The field officer is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato.

loans.name: Buken

texts.ru: Букен 47 лет, замужем, воспитала 4  детей. Букен начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве в 1996 году с 15,000 KGS. Имея многолетний опыт и знания которые проникли глубоко в кровь. Букен имеет очень хорошее хозяйство. В хозяйстве имеется 2 лошади, 2 коровы и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Букен обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения доходов от продажи молока. На доходы от проекта намерена направить на свадьбу сыновей.
texts.en: Buken is 47 years old, married and raised 4 children.  She started her own livestock and agriculture business in 1996 with 15,000 KGS.  She has many years of experience and knowledge that runs in her veins.  Buken has very good facilities.  Today she owns 2 horses, 2 cows and 10 sheep.  With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy 2 cows to increase her income from the sale of milk.  The additional revenue from this endeavor will be used to pay for her son's weddings.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Dorine is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Hope Group members. The ten of them, eight women and two men, are farmers in Teso District. 

Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum, will be delivered to Dorine on credit. Dorine joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Dorine joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Dorine was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 5½ bags per ½ acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and repair her home. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Dorine’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Janyl-Myrza

texts.ru: Жаныл-Мырза 29 лет, вдова, воспитывает троих детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Жаныл-Мырза занимается животноводством. Начатое 2 года назад с  суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от перепродажи скота. Благодаря упорному труду Жаныл-Мырза, ее поголовье насчитывает 1 дойной коровы, 1 теленка, 15 овец и 5 голов коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жаныл-Мырза обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Жаныл-Мырза планирует вложить в ремонт своего дома.
texts.en: Janyl-Myrza is 29 years old, a widow and is raising 3 children.  As a source of income for her family, she works with livestock.  Beginning two years ago with a sum of 50,000 KGS, her business now brings in around 8,000 KGS each month from the resale of cattle.  Thanks to her hard work, Janyl-Myrza today owns 1 milk cow, 1 calf, 15 sheep, and 5 goats.  With the goal of further growing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 KGS to buy cattle.  Janyl-Myrza plans to use the income to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 41-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 6 months to 14 years. He describes himself to be a flexible and jovial man. 

Daniel operates a food stall and butcher shop where he sells roasted and raw meat. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds for improving the business. 

Daniel will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy meat for roasting and raw meat to sell. His business goal is to be the best supplier of meat within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM, after managing to pay a previous loan of KES 150,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy meat for roasting and raw meat to sell.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 29-year-old who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He studied in secondary school. 

He purchased a motorbike (second-hand) two years ago for a transport business to cover his personal expenses. He faced a challenge of whether to be free to continue his studying or to work with his motorbike. He would like to increase his income. 

So, he took a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy a new motorbike that can help him to improve his living conditions. He hopes to save money in order to replace this motorbike with a new bus.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike that can help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Baraka is a group of fifteen farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Nicholas. The group has ten women and five men. Nicholas is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. 

Farming inputs, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum, will be delivered to Nicholas on credit. Nicholas joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season.
