Nicholas joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family and to improve his farming techniques with One Acre Fund methods.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Nicholas was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, he was able to harvest 7 bags per ½ acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. 

Nicholas’ group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 7½ acres of maize and sorghum.

The field officer is on the front right side of the photo, bending a little and in a brown skirt suit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and maize.

loans.name: Shihunila Group

texts.en:
Anjelina’s group has ten farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Anjelina is pictured on the right of Shihunila Group with her hand raised. She is pictured amongst the two men and eight women of her group. 

Angelina will receive input loans capable of planting ½ acre with sorghum, millet and maize. She first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Anjelina joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and enjoy the best input prices offered by One Acre Fund.

Anjelina reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 8 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and buy a cow. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Anjelina’s group will receive 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and maize.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos, dos quais 3 frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como fotógrafo por conta próprio. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra do murro de vedação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir o murro e construir um aviário e um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a insuficiência de fundos para realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en: Fernando is married and has 6 children, 3 of whom attend school.  He owns the home where he lives and he does not support anyone else.  He works for himself as a photographer.  With this loan he plans to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue construction of a wall around his home.  In the future he would like to finish construction on the wall and build an aviary and commercial shop.  For this reason, he promises to pay back his loan on time in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is a lack of funds to complete all of his projects.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Angelica

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 5 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e sustenta seus 3 netos que vivem com ela.
Trabalha como empregada doméstica. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a falta de fundos e conseguir manter se saudável para poder alcançar os seus objectivos.
texts.en: Angelica is a widow and mother to 5 adult children.  She owns her home and she supports 3 grandchildren who live with her.  She works as a maid.  With this loan she plans to purchase construction materials (cement, metal panels, beams, etc.) to continue construction on her home.  In the future she wants to finish her home to provide better comfort to her family.  For this reason she promises to make her payments on time in order to request more from Hluvuku.  The challenges she faces are a lack of funds and staying healthy in order to be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, metal panels, beams, etc.) to continue construction on her home.

loans.name: Mbako Group

texts.en:
Betty is a member of the Mbako Group in the Chwele District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers: 6 women and 4 men. Betty is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Betty first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2007 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Betty joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family. 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Betty was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize per ½ an acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 20 bags per ½ an acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. Betty’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ an acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 5 acres of millet and sorghum.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Zablon is a member of the Maendeleo Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured with 18 One Acre Fund farmers: 13 women and 5 men. Zablon is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum cultivation. Zablon first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Zablon joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and benefit from the best prices offered by One Acre Fund.

Zablon reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 2 1/2 bags of maize per ½ an acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 7 bags per 1/2 acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and use the rest to pay for the loan package. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Zablon’s group members will take input loans of ½ an acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 9 acres of land.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Viúva e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 2 ainda frequentam a Escola, vivem na casa própria e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ela.
Trabalha como agricultora tem a própria machamba. Com este empréstimo pretende comprar sementes e fertilizantes para aplicar na sua machamba.
No futuro deseja trabalhar mais e construir um estabelecimento comercial para venda de produtos diversos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ter acesso a crédito maiores para poder concretizar os seus objectivos.
texts.en: Maria is a widow and mother to 5 children, 2 of whom still attend school.  She owns the home where they live and she also supports 4 grandchildren who live with her. She works in agriculture and has her own field.  With this loan she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers to use in her field.  In the future she hopes to work more and build a shop to sell various products.  For this reason she promises to pay her loan on time in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.   The challenge she faces is access to more credit in order to realize her goals.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to use in her fields.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos, alguns ainda continuam com os estudos frequentando já nível superior, vive na casa própria e sustenta uma neta que vive com ele.
É enfermeiro de profissão e com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para continuar com a construção da varanda e casa de banho.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua residência para garantir melhores condições de habitação para a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é  ter acesso mais créditos.
texts.en: Antonio is married and has 6 children, some of whom still are continuing their education at the high school level.  He owns the home where he lives and also supports a granddaughter who lives with him.  He is a nurse.  With this loan he plans to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue construction on a veranda and a bathroom.  In the future he wants to finish construction on his home to provide better living conditions to his family.  For this purpose he promises to make his loan payments on schedule in order to request additional loans from Hluvuku.  The challenge he faces is access to more credit.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (iron, cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue construction of a veranda and bathroom.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 29 años de edad ,esta casado con Yenhy y tiene un hijo de 5 años respectivamente.Posee una vivienda construida a base de adobe el cual adquirió hace algunos años atrás.
Posee dos terrenos el cual dedica integralmente a la producción de cacao y café orgánico siendo este el principal sustento económico de su familia.
Inicialmente se desempeñaba como trabajador particular antes de asumir su responsabilidad conyugal puesto que le permitió trabajar de manera fluida y acumular capital para la compra de su primer terreno.Según comenta el iniciarse de manera independiente fue algo complicado al no poseer dinero suficiente para contratar trabajadores y hacia doble trabajo, esto lo motivo a seguir creciendo.Dentro de las principales actividades que se debe desempeñar en la producción de cacao esta el reemplazo de las plantaciones desfasadas por plantones de almácigo a través del injerto de los tallos para el cual es necesario adquirir plantas de almácigo, abono orgánico y mano de obra por parte de trabajadores del lugar.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, agradece desde ya esta oportunidad y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Requiere contar con S/.2,000 soles e invertirlos en la contrata de trabajadores y proceder con el reemplazo de sus plantaciones desfasadas.
texts.en:
Mario, 29, is married to Yenhy and has a five-year-old son. He owns an adobe house that he bought several years ago. He has two plots of land on which he grows cacao and organic coffee to support his family. He began working for himself after getting married, since this let him work a flexible schedule and save money to buy his first piece of land. He says that starting to work independently was not easy, since he lacked capital to hire workers and had to work doubly hard. This motivated him to grow his business.

One of the main activities associated with growing cacao is replacing older plants with plants from the seedling nursery by grafting the stems. You must buy seedlings and organic fertilizer and pay laborers to carry out this process. This is Mario's first loan cycle with Kiva. He is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make his payments on time. He needs S/.2,000 soles to pay workers and to replace old plants.

loans.use: to pay workers.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana de 36 años de edad , esta casada con Alfredo y tiene de dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de material noble.
Es propietaria de un terreno agrícola el cual dedica integralmente a la producción y mantenimiento de cacao orgánico,llego a esta parte de su región con motivo de hallar una mejor calidad de vida a base de productos tropicales, siendo el cacao uno los productos más comerciales,primero se inicio como jornalera y es donde conoce a su actual esposo con quien compra su terreno agrícola.Al ser el cacao un producto cuya atención debe ser constante debe de contar siempre con un capital de trabajo el cual invierte en el contrato de trabajadores del lugar para diversas tareas complicadas así como la compra de abono orgánico y demás gastos que genera su actividad.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se muestra muy agradecida por la confianza  brindada y espera ser puntual en el pago de su préstamo.
Desea en esta primera ocasión contar con S/.1,000 soles para contratar trabajadores e iniciar con la cosecha de las mazorcas de cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, age 36, is married to Alfredo.  They have two children, and they live in a house made from sturdy material.  She has a piece of land that she devotes entirely to the production and maintenance of organic cacao.  

She came to this part of her region in order to find a better quality of life through tropical products.  As cacao is one of the most commercial products, she first started as a day worker.  That is where she met her husband, with whom she bought her agricultural land.

Cacao is a product that needs constant attention.  She needs to always have working capital in order to hire workers from the area, to buy organic fertilizer, and for the other expenses that her business activity generates.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She is very grateful for the confidence placed in her, and she plans to be punctual with her loan payments.

She wishes to use her first loan for 1,000 soles to hire workers to start harvesting the organic cacao pods.

loans.use: to hire local day workers.

loans.name: Shobo

texts.en:
Shobo is married and has six school-going children. He owns a house with no electricity or piped water, and his greatest monthly expense is food. He has a motorbike transportation business, and he has been in this business for five years. He also does farming to earn a living.

He is asking for a loan of KSHS 10,000 to buy spanners and bolts for his motorbike to enable him to run his business well.

loans.use: To buy spanners and bolts for his motorbike

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía de 37 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijas con quienes vive en una casa construida de adobe.
Se inició desde hace 15 años de manera independiente en las actividades productivas concernientes  a la producción de cacao y café orgánico gracias a unos terrenos que adquirió a un buen precio por parte de unos tíos.
Dentro de sus plantaciones comenta que es muy necesario aplicar los cuidados respectivos correspondientes a su campaña productiva la cual parte desde al deshierbo, aplicación de abono orgánico en donde es necesario contar desde ya con capital de trabajo para adicionalmente contratar trabajadores con el fin de agilizar las tareas de mantenimiento especialmente la de deshierbo considerado por ella como una labor muy complicada.
A futuro desea seguir trabajando con la motivación que la caracteriza y obtener capital para la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijas.
Requiere para esta primera ocasión contar con S/.1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores y proceder con el segundo deshierbo de campaña indispensable para obtener mazorcas de calidad a la llegada de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Rosalía, 37, is divorced and has two daughters who live with her in their adobe house. Fifteen years ago, she began working for herself, growing cacao and organic coffee on some land she bought at a good price from an uncle. She says it is very important to take proper care of the plantings during each part of the growing cycle by weeding and spreading organic fertilizer. To do this, she needs money to hire more workers to speed up the work, especially the weeding, which she says is complicated.

Rosalia wants to keep working hard and obtain funding to build a house with good materials, in hopes of improving her daughters' lives. She needs S/.1,000 nuevos soles for this first loan so that she can hire workers to do the second weeding necessary to produce quality cacao pods for the harvest.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Reinan

texts.es:
Reinan de 24 años de edad, esta casado con Irma y juntos residen en una vivienda construida a base de adobe.Reinan se dedica íntegramente a la producción de cacao y café orgánico gracias a unas parcelas que adquirió con el paso del tiempo.Desde niño siempre brindo su firme apoyo para las diversas actividades de mantenimiento siendo un hijo ejemplar pero al culminar el colegio y sin hallar una salida rumbo a una educación superior no perdió mas tiempo y optó por incursionar en el campo de manera independiente  generando ingresos junto a Irma con quien logro hacer posible la compra de su primera parcela colindante a la de sus padres.El hecho de trabajar junto a su esposa le es muy reconfortante porque considera que la unión laboral es un buen aliente para el futuro de una familia unida.Dentro de las necesidades que posee su labor es la de contar con capital necesario para las diversas tareas de mantenimiento tales como son el de realizar el primer deshierbo de campaña esencial para limitar el consumo de nutrientes por parte de la mala hierba optimizando su producción, esta tarea debe realizarse con el apoyo de trabajadores y de manera uniforme, motivo por el cual acude a su entidad financiera solicitando el financiamiento del caso.Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y esta agradecido por la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Requiere para esta primera ocasión contar con S/.2,000 soles y contratar trabajadores para desempeñar el primer deshierbo de maleza de sus arboles de cacao.
texts.en:
Reinan is 24 years old and is married to Irma. They live together in a home constructed from adobe. Reinan makes a living entirely from the production of cacao and organic coffee, thanks to some plots of land that he acquired over time. 

From the time he was a child, he always provided his firm support for various maintenance activities, being an exemplary son. Upon graduating high school and not finding a way to get a higher education, he didn't lose any more time and opted to venture into the fields independently, generating income together with Irma, with whom he made possible the purchase of their first plot of land, adjacent to that of his parents. Working together with his wife is very heartwarming for him because he thinks that their working union is good encouragement for the future of a united family.

Among the needs he has for his work is that of having the capital necessary for the various maintenance tasks such as the first essential weeding campaign to limit the consumption of nutrients by the weeds, thus optimizing his production. This task should be done with the support of workers and in a uniform manner, so he went to his financial institution requesting financing for his case.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the opportunity provided and commits to making his monthly payments in a punctual manner. On this first occasion, he requires 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles and to hire workers to perform the first weeding around his cacao trees.

loans.use: to hire workers from the area.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy house building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of her family's house

loans.name: Mukulima Group

texts.en:
Richard’s group has 17 farmers and is located in Chwele District. Richard is pictured on the right of Mukulima Group with his hand raised. Richard is pictured amongst the 4 men and 13 women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and sweet potato. Richard first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2007 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Richard joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to best input prices of hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Richard described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Richard’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Apalupalut Group

texts.en:
Apalupalut Group is located in Teso District. It is a group of 1 woman and 12 men led by Moses pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Moses’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access the best input prices. 

Last year, Moses harvested 1 1/4 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land. He is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business. Moses’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 6.5 acres of millet and sorghum. 

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Rafael

texts.pt:
Viúvo e pai de 9 filhos, dos quais 3 ainda frequentam a escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como chefe da localidade de Gueguegue.Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas, pedra, ferro, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra do murro de vedação da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir o murro, mobilar a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e economizar os fundos para realizar todos seus projectos.
texts.en:
A widower and father of 9 children, 3 of which are still in school, Rafael lives in his own home and does not support anyone else.
He works as a leader of the town of Gueguegue. He plans to buy construction materials with this loan (such as cement, boards, stone, iron and others)  in order to continue the work on the fencing wall sealing his home.
In the future, he wants to complete the fence, furnish his home and buy a vehicle for personal transport.  For these reasons, he is committed to repaying the loan which he has undertaken, in order to request further loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is to work harder and save the funds to realize all of his projects.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, boards, stone, iron, and others) to continue the work on the fencing wall of his home.

loans.name: Lukhuna Group

texts.en:
Mary is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Lukhuna Group members.  The 14 of them, 9 women and 5 men, are farmers in Chwele District.   Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Mary first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Mary joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Mary described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mary’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay college fees for his child

loans.name: Bukusu Group

texts.en:
Metrine is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Bukusu Group members. The 12 of them, 11 women and 1 man, are farmers in Chwele District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum. Metrine joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Metrine joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to best input prices of  hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Metrine described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Metrine’s group will receive 6 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo tiene 39 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Desde hace 20 años trabaja como albañil. El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cambiar el techo de su casa. De esta manera podrá mejorar su vida, ya que no se le mojara su vivienda en época de invierno, estarán seguros y evitaran enfermedades respiratorias.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 39 years old. He has three children. He has been working as a bricklayer for 20 years. 

He is asking for a loan from Fundación Campo to replace the roof of his home. This is the way he can improve his life, so his house isn’t damp in the winter, making it safer and avoiding respiratory diseases.

loans.use: to replace the roof of his home

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo tiene un negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, tiene dedicándose a las ventas de este productos desde hace 5 años, entre el y su esposa la señora Myrna Yolanda son los que atiende el local. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en mercancía y la compara de una carro para poder hacer las entregas mas rápido y sin problemas, y así su clientes estarán mas satisfechos por el servicio que le están dando. Por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para llevar acabo esta inversión y no quieren descapitalizar el negocio.
El señor Gerardo y su esposa son originarios de esta ciudad Nuevo Laredo, los dos han luchado mucho para salir adelante y pudieron darles el estudio necesario a sus hijos quienes ya tienen su propia familia.
Desea que su negocio tenga mas ingreso y así pronto podrá tener otra sucursal y podrá ayudar a otras personas económicamente con trabajo.
texts.en:
Geraldo has a business selling natural health products. He has been in the business for five years and he and his wife attend to the business.

He is asking for a loan to invest in merchandise and to buy a car in order to make deliveries more rapidly and without problems, so his customers will be more satisfied with the service they are offering. At the moment he does not have the money necessary to carry out this investment and they do not want the business to be undercapitalized.

Gerardo and his wife are originally from this city, Nuevo Laredo. The two have fought hard to get ahead so they could give the necessary education to their children who already have their own families.

He wants his business to have more income and soon be able to have another branch and provide work opportunities for other people.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a car for the business

loans.name: Akisiaun Group

texts.en:
The One Acre Fund Akisaun Group is comprised of a group of five farmers, three women and two men, in Teso District and is headed by Habbakuk (seen on the right with his hand raised). Enough seed and equipment to farm half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum will be given to each farmer on credit so that together the group will receive enough supplies to farm two and a half acres in all.

Habbakuk is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited to be enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Last year he harvested seven bags of maize on one acre of land but is now excited at the prospect of improving his harvest. Through One Acre Fund he will have access to hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices.

Habbakuk hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to grow enough food for his family, send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a 40-year-old, married man. He has five children, whose ages range from 2 to 18 years. He describes himself as a focused man. He operates a dairy farming business, where he looks after cows and sells milk. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located within a local village, and his primary customers are local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is stiff competition within the area.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase another cow. His business goal is to own another dairy cow within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Rukhsora

texts.ru: Рухсора жительница города Кургантюбе, расположенный на юге Таджикистана. Ей 34 года. Она разведена и у нее есть сын и дочь, которые учатся в школе. У Рухсоры высшее экономическое образование. Однако она не работала по своей специальности. Сейчас Рухсора хочет начать свой бизнес. Около дома у нее есть магазин и она хочет заняться там продажей продуктов питания. С этой целью она обратилась за кредитом. Рухсора просит кредит для закупа товаров (продутов питания) в свой магазин и тем самым начать торговую деятельность.
texts.en: Rukhsora is a resident of Qurgan-Tube, located in the south of Tajikistan.  She is 34 years old, divorced and she has a son and daughter who both are in school.  Rukhsora has a degree in economics.  However, she never found work relevant to her degree.  Now, she wants to start her own business.  Near her home there is a store that she would like to rent to sell food goods out of.  She has applied for a loan with this goal in mind which she will use to buy inventory for the store which will start her trading activities.

loans.use: to purchase food goods for resale

loans.name: Wekhalilikha Group

texts.en:
Carolyne is a member of Wekhalilikha Group, in Chwele District. The group is comprised of 14 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 2 men. Carolyne is standing on the right side of the picture, with her hand raised. She is receiving an agricultural input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Carolyne first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Carolyne joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to the best input prices for hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Carolyne described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Wekhalilikha Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on seven acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Idd

texts.en:
Idd is a hard worker who appreciates Kiva lenders who previously backed him in his efforts selling vegetables and fruits. He is hardworking and aspires to see his business grow.

Idd again comes to you asking for a loan of 20,000 KES through Yehu to buy more bags of cabbages, tomatoes, onions, spices and dried fish. With his profits he hopes to boost his business and so care for his family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of vegetables, spices and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.es: Jorge Alejandro 68 años de edad soltero con 9 hijos y 2 de ellos aun a su cargo, es originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado sur del occidente del país, Jorge es una persona responsable muy trabajador, hace 7 años que el tiene su propio negocio, que es la pesca artesanal, el cual inicia desde muy joven a trabajar en este ramo, y  asi logra obtenerlo con muchos sacrificios y esfuerzos, el poco a poco ha ido logrando sacar a delante a sus hijos ahora solo le faltan dos de ellos para verlos coronar una carrera profesional ya que el no logro realizar ese sueño, el esta solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de dos trasmayos para su negocio ya que se averiaron y no desea incumplir con sus clientes fijos y eventuales mas en estas fechas Semana Santa que su negocio crece en mayor demanda. Jorge esta muy agradecido con los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que le brindan a los comerciantes pequeños de países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida
texts.en:
Jorge Alejandro is 68 years old, single, with 9 children, 2 still in his care. He is originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the southwestern part of the country.

Jorge is a trustworthy, hardworking person. He has had his own business for 7 years in artisan fishing. He has been working in this field since he was very young and so he has earned it though a lot of sacrifices and struggles. Little by little he has been raising his children in order to see them complete a professional career, except for two of them, as he was not able to realize this dream.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy 2 fishing nets for his business as his are damaged and he does not want to default on the orders his regular customers have placed and any holiday orders for Easter so that his business grows in greater demand.

Jorge is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the help given to small entrepreneurs in poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy two fishing nets for his artisan fishing business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a married woman. She has 10 children. She describes herself as a principled woman. She operates a livestock farm, where she sells goats. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a local village, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is disease outbreaks, which lead to many goats dying. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase goats to sell. Her business goal is to be a large-scale livestock farmer, within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell

loans.name: Akimor Group

texts.en:
Akimor is a group of six farmers in Teso District, represented by Soteri. The group has four women and two men. Soteri is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him, on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Soteri is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and obtain the best input prices. 
 
Soteri managed to harvest two bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest much more! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Akimor Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on three acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son’s tuition

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is 42 years old, married and a father of four children. For the last four years he has earned a living by selling milk in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of 6,000 KES.

Franklin was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He is applying for a third loan, this time for 30,000 KES, to buy additional dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves and water cans.

With his increase in profits Franklin will pay school fees for his children as well as expand his farming activities. He would like to venture into mixed farming with a view to increasing his income so as to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional dairy equipment such as milk cans, milking gloves and water cans.

loans.name: Bintihamadi

texts.en:
Bintihamadi is married and she is the mother of three children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water, and her greatest expenses are food and school fees.

Bintihamadi runs a hotel (restaurant), and her customers are her fellow villagers. She aspires to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan of KES 35,000 to buy more sugar, wheat flour, rice, beans, tomatoes, and spices to satisfy the needs of her clients and, in turn, improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, wheat flour, rice, beans, tomatoes, and spices

loans.name: Tonui

texts.en: Tonui is a 40-year-old married man. He has 5 children. Tonui describes himself as a focused man. He operates a farm where he sells maize, cabbages, potatoes, and other crops. His business is located within a densely populated rural area, and his primary customers are everyday consumers from the village. Tonui describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate farm inputs. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seed. His goal is to improve his agribusiness within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Mbantie Group

texts.en:
Christine is a member of Mbantie Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 6 women and 4 men. Christine is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Christine first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Christine joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and access the best input prices.

Christine reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 5 bags per 1/2 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Christine’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.  

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and soghum.

loans.name: Muungano A Group

texts.en:
Muungano A is a group of 10 farmers in Chwele District, represented by Jestimore. The group has five women and five men. Jestimore is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him, on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Jestimore joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2009, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Jestimore joined One Acre Fund so that he could grow enough food for the family, and use his increased profits to send his children to school.

Jestimore described his last year's harvest, as a One Acre Fund farmer, as excellent. He hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to repair his home. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Muungano A Group will receive a total of five acres' worth of inputs, on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 41-year-old, married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as a creative woman. She operates a farm, where she grows and sells Irish potatoes and maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a densely-populated rural area, and her primary customers are daily consumers from the village. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate farm inputs.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase farm inputs -- that is, fertilizer and seed. Her business goal is to purchase another piece of land for farming, within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs -- that is, fertilizer and seed for growing potatoes and maize

loans.name: Chemwai Group

texts.en:
Chemwai Group is a group of twelve farmers, ten women and two men, in Chwele District and is headed by Richard (seen on the right with his hand raised). Enough seed and equipment to farm half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum will be given to each farmer on credit so that together the group will receive enough supplies to farm six acres in all.

Richard first joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 season and is now enrolling for Long Rains 2013. He joined the fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices and grow enough food for the family. He described his harvest as excellent last year and now hopes for another good year.

Richard hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices.

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru: Гузал 48 года. Она чистоплотная и хорошая хозяйка и поэтому в ее доме всегда царит мир и уют. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает в  фермерском хозяйстве  и получает маленькую зарплату. Гузал  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием гранаты, так как имеет 1,5 га земли, где можно развивать садоводство. Ее муж будет помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она будет продавать полученный урожай на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ для покупки минерального удобрения, семена и оплатить другие расходы бизнеса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Guzal is 48 years old.  She's a good, and tidy homemaker and her home is always peaceful and comfortable.  She's married and has 3 children.  Her husband works on a farm and receives little pay.  Guzal decided to help her husband for the welfare of her family.  With this goal in mind, she took the course "To Get Ahead" offered by the Women's Business Association and received a certificate of completion.  Now, she is equipped to organize her business and become successful.  She wants to begin growing pomegranates since she has 1.5 hectares of land available to be farmed.  Her husband will help her with her business activities.  She will sell her harvest at a local market.  She's asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds and pay for other business expenses.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for organizing new business

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años de edad, esta separada de su esposo y tiene dos hijas. Vive un una casa construida de adobe junto a su mama y una hija. Se dedica a la elaboración de delantales para la venta,; también, costuran faldas y blusas de vecinas. Esta actividad la realiza desde que tiene 20 años de edad y fue su mamá la que le enseñó el oficio. Las ventas las realiza con el apoyo de la mamá y la hija en el mercado municipal y en comunidades vecinas. A este negocio le debe la mantención y el estudio de bachillerato que les proporciono a sus hijas.

Las materias primas para preparar los delantales los compra en el mercado municipal de La Ciudad a unos 6 km de su comunidad, haciendo uso del transporte público.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una maquina de costura semi-industrial que le permita realizar trabajos de mejor calidad. Está calificada por el ministerio de educación como una persona que puede  confeccionar  uniformes escolares que proporcionan  las escuelas publicas de la zona.

Con esto logrará independizarse en lo que se refiere a la confección de uniformes escolares que le adjudica el ministerio de educación, dejará de hacerlo con maquinas de otras personas y mejorará sus ingresos al dejar de trabajar por obra.

Su dese es, comprar tres maquinas de costura semi-industriales y emplear dos personas en la elaboración de prendas de vestir, para que las puedan vender su hija y su mamá y mejorar los ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Maria, who is 44 years old, is separated from her husband and has two daughters. She lives in a house constructed of adobe, along with her mother and one daughter. She makes aprons to sell, and she also sews skirts and blouses for neighbors. She has been doing this work since she was 20 years old, and it was her mother who taught her how to do this work. She makes her sales in the municipal market and in neighboring communities with the help of her mother and her daughter. She owes the support of her daughters and the secondary school studies that she offered them to this business.

She buys the basic materials to make the aprons in the municipal market in La Ciudad, some 6 kilometers from her community, making use of public transportation.

The loan that she is soliciting from Fundación Campo is to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine that will allow her to produce work of better quality. She is qualified by the ministry of education as a person who can make the school uniforms that the public schools in the zone provide.

With this she will manage to become independent with regard to the production of school uniforms that the ministry of education assigns. She will stop doing this with the machines of others and will improve her income by not working on contract.

Her wish is to buy three semi-industrial sewing machines and employ two people in the production of clothing for her mother and daughter to sell, and to improve the family income.

loans.use: to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine that will allow her to produce work of better quality.

loans.name: Lambachwet Group

texts.en:
The One Acre Fund Lambachwet Group is comprised of a group of ten farmers, all women, in Chwele District and is headed by Caro (seen on the right with her hand raised). Enough seed and equipment to farm half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum will be given to each farmer on credit so that together the group will receive enough supplies to farm five acres in all.

Caro is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited to be enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Last year she harvested four bags of maize on one-half acre of land and is now excited at the prospect of harvesting even more. Through One Acre Fund she will have access to hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices.

Caro hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to grow enough food for her family, send her children to school and repair her home.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda de 43 años de edad, esta casada con Gregorio  y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Se dedica a diversas actividades en el campo, teniendo como principal fuente de ingreso la venta de granos de cacao seco que extrae de sus parcelas ,lleva casi 20 años en el rubro y a lo largo del tiempo y con el apoyo de su esposo logró expandir la dimensión de sus terrenos de cultivo con la compra de parcelas colindantes con el cual incremento su producción de cacao
Es una actividad muy delicada puesto que es necesario brindar en casi toda la época del año un constante mantenimiento el cual requiere a su vez capital necesario para contratar trabajadores que son esenciales principalmente en la cosecha, con el paso de los años esta labor le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida de a pocos es por ello que con motivo de buscar una mejora en su calidad de vida espera trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza y posteriormente iniciar con la construcción de su vivienda a base de ladrillos y cemento.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y esta agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan y muestra su firme compromiso para el pago responsable de sus cuotas.
Espera contar con S/.1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores y proseguir con la cosecha de las mazorcas de cacao.
texts.en:
Rayda is 43 years old, is married to Gregorio and has 2 children, who she lives with in a house constructed from adobe. She makes a living from various activities in the fields, having as her principal source of income the sale of dry cacao beans that she extracts from her plots of land. She has been doing this over the course of nearly 20 years. Over time, with the support of her husband, she has managed to expand the dimensions of her cultivated land by purchasing adjacent plots. With these she has increased her production of cacao.

This is a very delicate activity as it is necessary to provide constant maintenance almost year-round. This requires in turn the capital needed to hire workers, who are essential primarily for the harvest. Over the years this work has gradually allowed her to improve her quality of life. Due to this, with the objective of improving her quality of life, she hopes to work with her characteristic motivation and then initiate the construction of a new home made of bricks and cement. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the opportunity it provides and demonstrates her firm commitment to the responsible payment of her fees. She hopes to have 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to hire workers and carry out the harvest of cacao pods.

loans.use: to hire workers from the area

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба женщина, которая берет вдохновенья от каждого истока современного развивающегося мира. У нее богатая фантазия и умелые руки. Насиба является хорошей портнихой. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети Бобочон и Оиша маленькие. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и не отправляет достаточно денег для содержания детей. Насиба хочет организовать свой бизнес услугой швеи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она будет предоставлять услуги швеи дома, а также будет продавать женские платья, собственного производства на местном рынке. С бизнесом она будет справляться одна. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ для покупки швейной машинки и тканей, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasiba is a woman inspired by each part of the modern, developing world.  She has an rich imagination and skillful hands.  Hasiba is a talented dressmaker.  She is married and has 2 children, Bobochon and Oisha, who are still young.  Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia and does not send enough money back home to provide for the children.  Nasiba wants to start her own business offering her sewing services.  With this goal in mind, she has taken the course "To Get Ahead" offered by the Women's Business Association and received a certificate of completion.  She will offer her services out of her home and will also sell her dresses and wares at a local market.  She will be the sole operator of the business.  With the income, she plans to provide her children with education and high-quality foods.  She is asking for a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric in order to get her business started.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria De Los Ángeles es originaria de la ciudad de Coahuila tiene ya mas de 15 años radicando en esta ciudad, tiene 6 años que falleció su esposo y ella se quedo bajo la responsabilidad de un hijo, quien esta estudiado la secundaria. Es empleado desde hace un año de una compañía de guardia de seguridad del centro de saludo de esta localidad. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la instalación del cable de electricidad, porque el que tiene actualmente esta en muy malas condiciones y necesita ya poner nuevas instalaciones, antes de que pueda pasar un accidente.
Con el ingreso que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad es para pagar el crédito, ya que recibe una pensión por viudez  las cual es para los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su hijo y que este en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles has lived in the city of Coahuila, where she has been living for over 15 years. Her husband died six years ago, leaving Maria alone to care for her son, who is now studying in high school. Maria has been working as a security guard for a health center for a year now. 

She is requesting this loan in order to replace the electrical wiring in her home because they are in very bad condition and she wants to replace them before an accident occurs. With the income she receives from her security guard job, she will repay the loan. She also receives a pension after the death of her husband to help pay for the household and education expenses for her son. Maria hopes to improve the quality of life of her son.

loans.use: to replace the electrical wiring in her home.

loans.name: Inuka Group

texts.en:
Inuka Group is located in Chwele District. It is a group of seven women and four men led by Vincent, pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for one half acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Vincent first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. 

Vincent joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and to eradicate poverty.  Vincent reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about three bags of maize per acre, but that with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested seven bags per one half acre! 

He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and improve his farming skills. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Vincent’s group members will take input loans of one half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five and one half acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Joyceline

texts.en:
Joyceline is married with two children and lives in Nyame Bekyere near Cape Coast. For the past six years she has made and sold fufu, a traditional Ghanaian dish composed of beaten boiled cassava and unripe plantains. She complements her fufu by also selling meat soup, fish soup, and rice balls. Her income goes toward paying for the family's general expenses.

Joyceline is applying for a 800 GHS loan through CRAN to buy more cassava and plantains so as to help her increase her fufu production. With greater profits she plans to venture into newer markets.

In the long run Joyceline’s ambition is to open her own restaurant specializing in fufu.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and plantains.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is married to a farmer. She uses her income to help her husband pay the general household expenses, as well as to save for a rainy day. Esi is a middle school graduate, and currently she sells charcoal, in her village of Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience in this trade, Esi sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her stock levels. Therefore, she will use her loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Esi wants to make her business self-sustainable, as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her charcoal enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dora María

texts.es:
Dora tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, que están estudiando. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, desde hace 15 años, ella es una mujer luchadora y con espíritu de superación. Para abastecer la demanda que posee ha contratado a dos empleadas, ya que ella solo no puede producir la cantidad de tortillas que le demandan; trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar maíz; insumo principal para su negocio y desea aprovechar que el precio esta bajo para adquirir bastante y mantener inventario y comprar una plancha nueva más grande; porque la que posee es pequeña. Con la inversión, espera atender mejor a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos ya que su objetivo es comprar su propia casa y brindarles el estudio a sus hijos y por supuesto mantener la estabilidad de su negocio para ayudar a sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Dora is 31 years old and a single mother of two children aged 10 and 8 years old who are studying. She has been dedicated to making and selling tortillas for the past 15 years. She is a fighter and possesses a self-improvement spirit. To meet the increasing demand of her product, she has hired two employees; this is due to the fact that she cannot produce the amount of tortillas that is demanded from her customers by herself. Dora works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo, will be used to purchase corn; the main supply for her business, taking advantage of its current low price in order to acquire and maintain inventory. She will also purchase a larger tortilla press to facilitate with manufacturing, because the one she currently owns is  small. With this investment, she expects to better serve her customers and increase revenue since her objective is to purchase her own home, provide education for her children and maintain stability for her business to help her brothers.

loans.use: purchase corn, the main supply for her business, and take advantage of it´s current low price.  This will allow her to stock up and keep her inventory high. She will also purchase a larger tortilla press to facilitate with manufacturing, because the one she currently owns is small.

loans.name: Nasambu Group

texts.en:
Nasambu is a group of 10 farmers in Chwele District, represented by Edith. The group has six women and four men. Edith is on the right side of the photo, with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her, on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. Edith first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Edith joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to grow enough food for the family.

Edith described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ acre of agricultural inputs, on credit. In total, Nasambu Group will receive five acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Vidaldina

texts.es: Vidaldina a sus 45 años de edad casada con tres hijos, todos estudian en secundaria, originaria de unos de los municipios  de Chinandega, es una mujer responsable, honesta, que ha ido creciendo poco a poco ella ha tiene ya 11 préstamos con fundación con los cuales ha realizado otro negocio que es el de brindar  el servicio de  molino, también aún sigue su negocio de pulpería donde ha incrementado su demanda al igual que sus clientes, por lo que ella siempre tiene producto para sus clientes cuando ellos necesitan. Actualmente Vidaldina está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más mercadería y abastecer a sus clientes lo cual comprar productos lácteos, granos básicos, como arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, entre otros también para dar mantenimiento a su molino y asi brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes, ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por la oportunidad que ellos les brindan a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Vidaldina is 45 years old, married, and has three high-school aged children. She lives in one of the towns of Chinandega. Vidaldina is a responsible and honest woman. She has already received 11 loans with Fundación León, which have helped her grinding business. She also has a small store and, recently, demand has increased as she's gained new customers. Vidaldina always tries to keep her store stocked with products her customers need.

Currently, she is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise to stock her store for her customers who require dairy products, and basic ingredients such as rice, sugar, corn, beans and other items. She also needs to have some maintenance work done on her grinder so that she is able to provide better service to her customers. 

Vidaldina is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity they have provided to those with scarce resources.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her grinder as well as to buy table cloths and basic ingredients, diary products, and other items.

loans.name: Chemi Chemi Group

texts.en:
Alice is pictured on the right with her hand raised amongst her Chemi Chemi Group members.  The 12 of them, 10 women and two men, are farmers in Chwele District.   

Farming inputs will be delivered to Alice on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant one half acre of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum. Alice first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Alice joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to the best input prices for hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Alice described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to buy cattle. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive one half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Alice’s group will receive a total of six acres' worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Antonio Jesús

texts.es:
Antonio de 54 años de edad, es un campesino emprendedor  que se ha esforzado por sacar adelante su familia. Desde hace más de treinta años se dedica a la cría y comercialización de porcinos, actividad que se convirtió en la fuente generadora de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su esposa y la educación de sus dos hijastras. Día a día ha logrado ampliar su negocio y hoy cuenta con  tres corrales y 10 lechones. Su mayor sueño es poder convertir su negocio en una gran microempresa que le permita proveer a todos los expendios de carne de su municipio. Razón, que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de materiales para la construcción de un nuevo corral y concentrado para alimentar de los lechones.
Espera que con esta inversión su calidad de vida mejore y pueda dar la cuota inicial para la adquisición de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Antonio, who is 54 years old, is an entrepreneurial farmer who has exerted himself to advance his family. For more than 30 years, he has raised and sold pigs, a business that became the source of income to support his wife and educate his stepdaughters. Day after day he has managed to expand his business, and today he has three pens and 10 piglets. His greatest dream is to be able to convert his business into a great micro-business that will allow him to supply all the meat sales in his town. This is what has motivated him to apply for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of materials to construct a new pen and buy concentrate to feed the piglets. 

He hopes that with this new investment his quality of life will improve and he can make the down payment for the acquisition of his house.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a new pen and buy concentrate for the feeding of piglets.

loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Betty is a member of Njete Group, in Chwele District. Njete Group is 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 9 women and 1 man. Betty is standing on the right side of the photo, with her hand raised. She is receiving an agricultural input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Betty first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season.  Betty joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family, and to use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Betty described her harvest as very good last year, but she believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her 2013 Long Rains harvest to send her children to school, and to buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Njete Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved African masks and sculptures, as well as in kente cloths. She would like to invest in the purchase of wood, polish, sandpaper and wood stain for production.

Adwoa has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I became involved in handicrafts through my mother, who sold Adinkra symbols and kente cloths. While helping my mother, I began to offer a small number of woodcarvings, which sold very well in the market. This inspired me to pursue woodcarving as a career. After a period of careful instruction, I opened up my own workshop, under the banner, 'God moves in mysterious ways.' Currently I have a team of fifteen artisans in my workshop.

"I am very thankful to the people who are contributing to this microcredit to assist me with my small business."

Use the link below to view Adwoa's African masks, wood carvings and kente cloth on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2328

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood, polish, sandpaper and wood stain for production.

loans.name: Belkin Karina

texts.es: Belkin Karina 24 años de edad soltera, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado al norte del occidente del país, ella inicia a trabajar desde muy joven ya que ella viene de una familia de pocos recursos económicos, los cuales no logra terminar sus estudios para así ayudar a su familia siendo ella la mayor de sus hermanos, ella logra con muchos esfuerzos y ganas de superación lograr obtener sus propio negocio que es la compra venta de cerdo en pie también en la venta de leche, cuajadas y leche agria, ella en sus momentos libres le gusta pasar con sus hermanos ir de paseo a ciertos lugares climáticos que les ofrece la naturaleza de esa localidad, uno de sus sueños es lograr terminar sus estudios obtener una carrera profesional y así de esa manera a poyar más a su familia, Belkin está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de un lote de cerdo en pie y también la compra de dos vacas paridas.
texts.en:
Belkin Karina is a 24-year-old, single woman from one of the towns of Chinandega, located in the northwestern part of the country. She started working at a young age because her family had scarce financial resources. She was not able to finish her studies, because as the oldest child, she had to help her family make ends meet. With much hard work and determination to succeed, Belkin Karina was able to start her own business buying and selling pigs as well as selling milk, cheese, and sour milk.

In her free time, she likes to tour the natural beauty of her country with her siblings. One of Belkin Karina's dreams is to study a professional career and be able to help her family more. She is requesting this loan in order to buy some pigs and two cows.

loans.use: to buy pigs and two cows.

loans.name: Yaarura Group

texts.en:
Charles is a member of Yaarura Group, in Chwele District.  The group is comprised of 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 6 women and 4 men. Charles is standing on the right, with his hand raised.  He is receiving an agricultural input loan, which will include all the materials needed for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Charles first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Charles joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to the best input prices, hybrid seed and fertilizer.

Charles described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Yaarura Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a widow with five children who lives in the village of Nyame Bekyer near Cape Coast. She is the sole breadwinner in the entire family and so must provide for all of them. For the past nine years she has cooked and sold kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish made of fermented corn or cassava dough that is partially cooked, then steamed and served rolled in banana leaves.

Ekua is applying for a 800 GHS loan from CRAN to buy increased amounts of corn and cassava and so increase her kenkey production. With new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the types of food that she sells so as to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of corn and cassava to make kenkey.

loans.name: Akichesit Group

texts.en:
Roshel is a member of Akichesit Group, in Teso District. The group is comprised of 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 3 men. Roshel is standing on the right side of the photo, with her hand raised. She is receiving an agricultural input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Roshel first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Roshel joined One Acre Fund in order to gain knowledge and skills in farming, and to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer. 

Roshel reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about 2 bags of maize per ½ acre. But, with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 10 bags per 1/2 acre, a five-fold increase! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Akichesit Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.   

(The field officer is standing on the left side of the photo.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima prepares and sells banku (a traditional Ghanaian dish made with fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish paste). She has been involved in this business for two years. Her banku is normally served with fried fish, peppers, and tomato sauce. 

Fatima operates her business in the town of Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast). She is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband with raising their children. Her loan will be used to purchase an increased quantity of maize and fish, which will help her to prepare more of her delicious banku to sell). She hopes to use the new profits to further expand her business and to one day open a banku stall, thus giving her the ability to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and fish to make banku

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 52-year-old married man with 4 children. He describes himself as hard-working and determined. He has operated a construction business for 10 years. His business is located within a busy and viable area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving his business. Francis will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase construction materials. His goal is to expand his business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan Guillermo de 23 años de edad, es un joven que busca la manera de salir adelante y brindarle a su hija de  un año de edad mejores condiciones de vida. No terminó el colegio porque siempre consideró que estudiar no era lo suyo, acciones de las  cuales hoy se arrepiente, al no lograr conseguir un buen empleo. Con la responsabilidad de velar por el bienestar de su bebe, optó por crear su propio negocio, dedicándose a la cría y engorde de cerdos. 
Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que desea invertir en la compra de cuido y adecuación de un corral, ya que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones.
Su mayor sueño es brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida alejada de las carencias económicas.
texts.en:
Juan Guillermo is 23 years old. This young man is searching for a means of getting ahead and offering better conditions of life for his 1-year-old daughter. Juan didn't finish school because he always thought studying wasn't for him, an attitude that today he repents, now that he is denied a good job. With the responsibility of caring for his baby, Juan has chosen to create his own business, dedicating himself to the care and fattening of pigs. 

Today, Juan is requesting a loan which he wishes to invest in obtaining the maintenance and upgrading of his pig corral, since the current corral is in very bad condition.

Juan's biggest dream is to offer his daughter a better quality of life, freed from economic concerns.

loans.use: to pay for the care and improvement of a pig corral.

loans.name: Faida Farmers Group

texts.en:
One Acre Fund’s Faida Farmers is a group of twelve farmers, ten women and two men, in Kakamega North District and is headed by Caleb. He seen on the right with his hand raised, while the field officer is at the left. Enough seed and equipment to farm half an acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum will be given to each farmer on credit so that together the group will receive enough supplies to farm six acres in all.

Caleb joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2010 season and is now enrolling for Long Rains 2013. He joined the fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices. He described his harvest as good last and believes he can have an even better one this year.

Cleophas hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to grow enough food for the family, send his children to school and repair his home.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seed and fertilizer at the best prices.

loans.name: Town Group

texts.en:
Mwalungo is a member of Town Group, in Teso District. The photo shows the group, which is comprised of 14 One Acre Fund farmers, 3 women and 11 men. Mwalungo is standing on the right side of the photo, with his hand raised. He is receiving an agricultural input loan, which includes all necessary materials for ½ acre of millet, sweet potato and sorghum cultivation. The 2013 Long Rains season will be Mwalungo’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer, and to gain knowledge and get a good harvest. 

Mwalungo managed to harvest four bags of maize on two acres of land, last year. As a One Acre Fund farmer, he hopes to harvest even more! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, and to buy a piece of land. For the 2013 Long Rains season, the Town Group members will take input loans of ½ acre, each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on seven acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Rasmi

texts.en:
Rasmi is 25 years old. She is married and has two children, who are six and three years old. In 2011, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Rasmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
