Gilda is a Peruvian artist, who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest her loan funds in the purchase of silver and gemstones, to use in continuing production of her jewelry. Gilda has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is her story:

"My pride in my Peruvian heritage comes through in my designs. My intention is to transmit energy, art; my life is sharing with others these things that I feel. My jewelry is designed with geometric profiles and encloses the universal roots of form and meaning, echoes that reverberate from the earliest times of humankind. I rescue the energies that natural stones gave to the spiritual and mystical life of the ancient Nazca peoples, and our own ancestors."

"To everyone who contributed to this microcredit, please receive a big hug and blessings all the way from Peru, as a thank you for offering me your support in this way. The microcredit will make it possible for me to replenish my stock as well as create new designs that I'm sure you'll like."

Use the link below to view Gilda's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5381

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of silver and gemstones, to use in continuing production

loans.name: Consuelo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Consuelo de 57 años de edad, es una guerrera que ha luchado por ofrecerle un bienestar a su familia. A pesar de que debió asumir la responsabilidad de criar y educar sola a su hijo, esto nunca fue un impedimento para ella y por el contrario su amor de madre la impulsó a laborar en toda clase de oficios con el propósito de brindarle a su hijo un techo donde vivir, un alimento que comer y una buena educación. 
Hoy agradece todas las experiencias que la vida le ha permitido vivir, porque asegura que con ellas aprendió a valorar la vida y a su familia. Después de padecer humillaciones y maltratos por personas sin escrúpulos, Consuelo decidió montar su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar y tener la oportunidad de dedicarle más tiempo a su hijo. Gracias a esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra surtido. Con el propósito de elevar el nivel de ventas y mejorar su condición económica, garantizándole a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 57 years old; she is a warrior who has fought to ensure the wellbeing of her family. Although she had to assume the responsibility of raising and educating her son alone, this was never an impediment to her, instead her love of motherhood drove her to work hard in all kinds of trades; in order to give her son a place to live, food to eat and a good education.
Today she is thankful for all the experiences that life has allowed her to live, because she is sure that through them she learned to value life and her family. After suffering humiliation and abuse by unscrupulous people, Consuelo decided to start her own business dedicated to the sale of basic consumption products in order to have the opportunity to spend more time with her son. Thanks to this activity she has managed to get ahead.
Today she is requesting a loan to invest in buying supplies, this in order to raise the sales level and improve her economic condition, guaranteeing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase basic consumption products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Marumba Bulala Group

texts.en:
Everlyne is a member of Marumba Bulala Group in Chwele District. She is pictured with ten One Acre Fund farmers, nine women and one man. Everlyne is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a half acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Everlyne first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2009 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Everlyne joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for her family.

Everlyne described her harvest as very good last year but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and repair her home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Everlyne’s group members will take input loans of a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
After successfully graduating from junior high school, Ayishetu is now an established businesswoman. She sells raw rice in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years now. Ayishetu is single. She uses her income to help support herself and her two elderly parents. 

Ayishetu will use the loan to purchase more bags or rice, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ayishetu  plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more bags or rice, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced with three children. She specializes in purchasing fresh fish and then smoking it for resale. She primarily operates  in Nyame Bekyere  (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about ten years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fresh fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fresh fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Rev. Daniel S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of primary school teachers in Makeni city. They have come together to request a loan of 14,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire team. With the help of this loan, they can meet certain financial challenges that their salaries alone cannot meet. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Rev. Daniel is the featured leader of this team. The 56-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is married to a teacher and the couple has eight children, four of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Rev. Daniel has been a schoolteacher for 36 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to buy house building materials – corrugated iron zinc, sand, nails, cements, rods, etc. — for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – corrugated iron zinc, sand, nails, cements, rods, etc. — for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima sells charcoal in her village of Nyame Bekyere  (near Cape Coast). She has been educated to the end of primary 6.  She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a retired security guard. 

Alima has been working in this enterprise for quite some time now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current charcoal stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her charcoal enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current charcoal stock levels.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a member of Upendo Group in Chwele District. He is one of the ten One Acre Fund farmers -- seven women and three men -- pictured. Patrick is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for a half acre of millet, sorghum and sweet potato. Patrick first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Patrick joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and because One Acre Fund delivers inputs on loan.

Patrick reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about five bags of maize per half acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 12 bags per three-quarters acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and repair his home. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Patrick’s group members will take input loans of a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on five acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sorghum and sweet potato

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda has been involved in a clothing business in Hohoe for the past five years. She has received education to middle school level.  

Freda is divorced and has one child. She is responsible for paying her child’s school fees and for other needs of her home. She also has two dependants whom she assists financially. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bundles of clothes. She hopes to save enough money from her new profits, to enable her expand her working capital and so that she can give her child a better quality education.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Faustine

texts.en:
Faustine is married and has two children. She has received schooling through middle school level. 

Faustine sells cloths and bowls at Hohoe, which she has done for four years. Her husband is a Mason. 

Faustine uses her income to assist her husband provide food for the family, and helps with some monetary issues of the family. Faustine will use the loan to buy more saucepans and introduce the sale of silver bowls and plastic bowls. With the new profits from her expanded business, Faustine plans to save and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more saucepans and introduce the sale of silver bowls and plastic bowls.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a small scale baker in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She specializes in making doughnuts, pastries and bread for a living. Abena has been working as a baker for close to four years.

Abena is married and has four childen. Her husband is a farmer. She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a permanent stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Even though she did not receive any formal education, Araba is a successful businesswoman. She extracts and consequently sells palm kennel oil in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 15 years. 

Araba is single without any children. She uses her income to support herself and her elderly parents. Araba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of palm fruit, thus aiding her to improve her overall palm oil sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of palm fruits, thus aiding her to improve her overall palm oil sales.

loans.name: Sundu E.c.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present this group of teachers from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to apply for a loan of 6,500,000 SSL in order to meet their own immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can easily make loan repayments. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Sundu is the featured leader of this team of teachers. The 50-year-old was born in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader. He has eleven children, three of whom are still attending primary and secondary schools. Sundu has been a school teacher for 32 years now. He has requested a loan in order to buy building materials for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Olga Lucía

texts.es:
Olga de 46 años de edad, es conocida en su barrio por su valentía y empeño de querer salir adelante. Asegura que el bienestar familiar es su mayor prioridad y por ello decidió trabajar a fin de mejorar las condiciones económicas de su hogar y ayudarle a su esposo.
Con los ahorros familiares y con el conocimiento de su cónyuge montó un taller dedicado a la elaboración y venta de llaves y chapas. En el cual labora diariamente de ocho de la mañana a siete de la noche. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en el mantenimiento de máquinas para la elaboración de llaves y la compra de surtido a fin de mejorar las ventas.
Su mayor deseo es permanecer en unidad con su familia y velar por el bienestar y la educación de sus cinco hijos.
texts.en:
Olga is 46 years old. She is known in her neighborhood for her courage and determination in her quest to get ahead. The well-being of her family is her highest priority and because of this she decided to work so she could help her husband improve her family’s financial situation.

With her family savings and her husband’s know-how she opened a shop where she makes and sells keys and locks. She works everyday from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. She is currently requesting a loan that she will use to maintain her key cutting machines and to stock her shop in order to increase her sales.

Her dream is to stay with her family and ensure the well-being and education of her five children.

loans.use: maintain her key cutting machines and stock her shop.

loans.name: Sanita's Group

texts.en:
Sanita is a 31-year-old mother of seven children. She and her husband earn money for their family by farming, digging for wages on neighboring farms, and sometimes resort to making charcoal. 

She frequently faces the challenge of inadequate rainfall for her crops. Since the local environmental resources are mismanaged, there are less and less mature trees for her charcoal business. 

She is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program because once the trees have grown, they will make fresh air and create a better environment on her farm. She plans on using the income from her KOMAZA trees to pay school fees and build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance and support.

loans.name: Beezandan

texts.en:
Mr. Beezandan, 58 years old, lives with his wife and nephew in Kerlen, an eastern boundary town in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working as a watchman at a primary school for 22 years, and all the colleagues respect him. His wife has retired from work and gets a state pension. All of his daughters live separately from their parents. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who strives for a better future.

The house in Kerlen that Beezandan lives in has deteriorated over the years, and it needs some renovation. So, he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase building and insulation materials, such as fiberglass, foam, planks and bricks. Using those materials, he will make an extension to his house, thus reducing the heat loss through walls and the door. More importantly, the extension and adding insulation will enable the family to burn less coal during harsh winter temperatures.

According to a national statistics agency, one of the main factors of air pollution in Mongolia is excessive usage of coal. Reducing this usage will contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to make an extension (reducing heat loss through walls and the door) and add insulation to his house, in order to stop heat loss

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en: John is a 37-year-old father of six children. He and his wife are farmers, who struggle with the droughts in the area that cause their crop yields to be low. He is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program, because the project will help safeguard the environment in his village. He plans on using the income from his KOMAZA trees to educate his children and to buy additional land.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Jumwa's Group

texts.en:
Jumwa is a 45-year-old widow and mother of five children. To care for her family, she digs on neighbors' farms for wages, and she borrows money from a friend to buy flour for making maandazi (donuts), which she then sells to her neighbors. One of the challenges that she faces in her work is that her maandazi business is so small that she makes very little profit from it.

She is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program, because of the cooperation and communal nature of the planting and weeding. She plans to use the income from her KOMAZA trees to pay school fees and to increase her business.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Bendera's Group

texts.en: Bendera is a thirty-eight year old mother of nine children. She is married but her spouse does not work. She cuts firewood to sell in the market, and sometimes resorts to making charcoal and coconut wine. She faces many challenges for her businesses including low prices for her firewood and charcoal in the market. She is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program because, in her words, "The stage after weeding the eucalyptus is shining and becomes nice in appearance!" She hopes to use the income from her KOMAZA trees to pay her children's school fees and to start a savings account in a bank.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Meliton

texts.es:
Meliton de 19 años de edad ,es un joven soltero y reside en la vivienda de sus padres construida a base de material noble. Comenta que desde niño siempre fue muy empeñoso en las diversas actividades agrícolas que desempeñaban sus padres, logrando de esta manera aprender de manera firme el oficio de la producción de cacao teniendo las condiciones técnicas necesarias.Al culminar el colegio y teniendo serios problemas económicos para desempeñar estudios superiores optó por incursionar en el rubro comercial gracias al apoyo y confianza de sus padres.A manera de generar ingresos se dedica desde hace 2 años a rentar terrenos agrícolas de mediana dimensión para proceder con la extracción de mazorcas logrando generar buenos ingresos a fin de campaña.
Para optimizar su producción debe aplicar el mantenimiento respectivo a sus plantaciones el cual parte desde reemplazar árboles desfasados por nuevos a través del famoso injerto de almácigos para el cual requiere contar con capital necesario, motivo por el cual acude a su entidad financiera ,ello es un trabajo colectivo que debe realizar con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar esperando de esta manera obtener la producción deseada.
Tiene en mente desempeñarse laboralmente en el campo para obtener ingresos sólidos que le permitan iniciar estudios superiores en la carrera de agronomía, ya que se siente muy a gusto con su trabajo en el campo y piensa que seria mejor apoyar con conocimientos profesionales al desarrollo de su localidad .Se siente muy a gusto y a la vez agradecido por la confianza brindada ya que le permite acceder a su primer crédito con Kiva por ello muestra su firme compromiso de cumplir de manera responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
Requiere para esta primera ocasión contar con S/. 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de almácigo y contrata de trabajadores para obtener una buena producción a fin de campaña.
texts.en:
Meliton is 19 years old, a young single man that resides at home with his parents at a place constructed of quality materials. He comments that as a child he was always very engaged in learning various agricultural activities performed by his parents, thus achieving a firm knowledge about the cocoa production trade including the necessary technical conditions. After finishing high school and facing serious financial difficulties to continue his studies and start college, he decided to venture into the commercial world with the support and trust of his parents. As a way to generate income to help his parents he has been working for over two years on leasing medium-size farmland to proceed with removal of cobs achieving good revenue at the end of the season.
To optimize production he needs to apply maintenance to the field which starts from replacing outdated plants by new trees through grafting seedlings, for which capital is required, this is why it is necessary for him to ask his financial institution for funds. This maintenance is a collective work to be carried out with the support of workers at the site in order to obtain the desired output.
He has in mind to keep working on this field, so he can generate solid revenue that will enable him to start college and pursue a career in the agriculture field. He feels very comfortable with his work in the field and thinks it would be better to support the development of his locality with professional knowledge. Meliton feels very comfortable and grateful for the trust given, which allows him to access his first loan with Kiva, therefore he shows his strong commitment to responsibly comply with the payment of his dues. He requires for this first loan S /. 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase seedling plants and hire workers in order to accomplish a good production by the end of the season.

loans.use: purchase seedling plants and hire workers.

loans.name: Kenga's Group

texts.en: Kenga is a fifty-one-year-old father of eleven children. He and his wife are farmers, but their agricultural business is challenging work due to the inadequate rainfall in the area. He is excited to join the KOMAZA microforestry program because the farms look very nice once the trees have grown, and the hard work the group does to prepare the plots for planting makes the group become very close. He plans to use the income from his KOMAZA trees to pay school fees for his children and to buy some cattle to start a dairy business.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support .

loans.name: Echo Mysterieux De Miniere Group

texts.fr:
Philamar est le coordinateur de son groupe Echo Mysterieux de Miniere. Ils habite dans la région de Miniere d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité. Il n'est pas marie il est pere de 15 enfants. Philamar a dirigé son business de menuisier pendant les 5 dernières années. Avant de commencer (menuiserie), il etait a cultivateur seulement. 

Philamar voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir avec duit du quincaillerie. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres du groupe ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon et produits alimentaires. Philamar dit que son but principal est agrandir son business et être possede un moyen pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Philamar is the coordinator of his group, Echo Mysterieux de Miniere.  They live in the Miniere (mining) region of Haiti where electricity is rare and water is very scarce.  Philamar is not married and is the father of 15 children.  Philamar has run his carpentry business for the past five years.  Before starting in carpentry, he was a farmer. 

 Philamar would like to use is loan to invest in hardware for carpentry. He hopes that this loan will aid in growing his business. The other members of his group need a loans for items such as coal and food products.  Philamar says that his main goal is to grow his business and to have a way to transport his materials.

loans.use: to buy hardware

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en: Joseph is a fifty-eight-year-old teacher and father of twelve children. His wife is also a teacher, but their pay is too low to meet the needs of the family. Joseph is planting trees with the KOMAZA microforestry program to earn income in the future, as well as to put a windbreak on his homestead. He plans to use the profit from his tree farm to educate his family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is a forty-seven-year-old single mother of five children. She earns money for her family through various means, including making charcoal, small scale farming, and working on neighboring farms for pay. Her work on others' farms is seasonal, and making charcoal is tiresome work with a low return. Sarah is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she has seen that other KOMAZA tree farms in her area are growing well. She intends to use her profits to pay school fees for her children and hopefully start another business that will make more money.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Refuge De Dumas 1 & 2 Group

texts.fr:
Cantave est le coordinateur de son groupe Refuge de Dumas. Il est marié mais il a 5 enfants. Cantave habite dans la ville de Dumas d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Cantave a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années. Avant de commencer ce commerce, Il etait a l’ecole.

Cantave voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des boeufs. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Des autres membres de les refuge ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. Cantave dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant. Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une camion pour transporter les animaux.
texts.en:
Cantave is the coordinator of his group  named “The Refuge of Dumas.” He is married and has five children. He lives in the town of Dumas in Haiti, where electric power is scarce and water supply is very limited. Cantave has been managing his business for seven years. Before launching his business, he was in school.

Cantave would like to use this loan to invest in buying cattle. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business. Other members of the group need a loan for their business such as selling charcoal, rice and fish. Cantave says that his main challenge is the lack of steady customers. He says that his main goal is expanding his business. His dream is to buy a truck for animal transport.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kenga's Group

texts.en: Kenga is a fifty-six-year-old father of nine children. He earns money for his family through small scale farming and tapping coconut wine. Kenga's agricultural endeavors suffer from the inadequate rainfall of the dryland region he calls home. He is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because he sees the organization as "intending to help farmers grow and develop well financially." Kenga is looking forward to using the profits from his tree farm to meet his family's basic needs, such as clothing and housing. He intends to use the money from his tree farm to educate his children, who will still be in school for at least a decade to come.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Kanze's Group

texts.en: Kanze is a fifty-five-year-old single mother of nine children, five of whom are still in school. She does a variety of manual labor jobs to earn money for her family, including working on road construction, clearing rural roads, small scale farming and making charcoal. The manual work is often labor-intensive with low wages, and the agricultural endeavors face the challenges of drought and low yields. Kanze is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so she can buy land for her family and build a good house. She would also like to start a bank account and save some of the money she earns from her tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Fathuma's Group

texts.en: Fathuma is a fifty-seven-year-old mother of seven children and a widow. She supports her family through small-scale farming, making and selling mandazi (doughnuts), and trading produce such as coconuts and mangoes. Fathuma does not have enough money to purchase good tools for her farming work and there is inadequate rainfall to produce good harvests. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she says, "KOMAZA trees will help my family and enable us to pay school fees." She also knows that planting trees will change the local environment for the better. In addition to using her tree farm profits to pay school fees, she wants to build a house which she can rent for income.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and introduce the sales of groundnuts/peanuts, beans and maize into her petty trading business.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: У него трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он -Рустам из Таджикистана, которому 28 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, пшеницу, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму   3000 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения, а также скота, так как он хочет развивать бизнес скотоводством тоже. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: His life is hard and his income low, but he has a kind heart and easy-going nature. His name is Rustam; he is from Tajikistan, 28 years old, married and raising two children. For over 10 years he has been growing produce, such as potatoes, wheat, carrots etc. Hn sells his harvested produce at the market. Since he  offers high quality produce, he has a lot of customer demand. His wife helps him in the business. IN order to provide for his family, he wants to develop his business, and increase the volume of his produce. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 TJS in order to buy mineral fertilizers as well as cattle, since he wants to be active in raising livestock as well. He will use the resulting business income to pay for his children’s education and improving his family’s life conditions. He needs your kindness and is counting on it.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and cattle .

loans.name: Vincentia

texts.en: Vincentia has been selling cloth and minerals (soft drinks) for the past twenty years at Hohoe. Vincentia has never been to school because she never had anyone to support her financially. She is a widow and has five children. Vincentia is responsible for all the monetary needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cloth and introduce other soft drinks so that she can make more profit. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to enable her to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more cloth and introduce other soft drinks

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in the Litein area of Kenya, an area known for heavy tea production and maize. She has three children and has been doing this work for five years.  Her primary income sources are milk and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is "milking." Her biggest challenge is "lack of adequate funds." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Chemur."

Alice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Because of the grace period."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. She said, "That most of them require people to be in groups."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Alice replied, "I will be in a position to pay fees for my children."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alice owns the following: a cow, but does not own a pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Матлуба трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она  живет одна с детьми, так как  ее муж уехал на заработки в другую страну. У нее 4 детей. Матлюба домохозяйка. Ее муж занимался откормом скота но ему пришлось уехать и Матлюба решила продолжить дело своего мужа. Ее муж по возможности присылает семье деньги но этого не достаточно. 
В данное время у Матлюбы имеется одна корова которая дает по 10-12 литров молока. Она также продает молочные продукты своим соседям и знакомым.  Старший сын Матлюбы помогает ей по откорму скота. 
Матлюба планирует накопить деньги и начать строить дом для своего старшего сына,чтобы после женитьбы он не нуждался не в чем. Для того чтобы достичь своей цели она трудится день и ночь.  
Матлюба запрашивает кредит для покупки еще одной коровы и корма для скота. Откормив скот планирует продать через некоторое время за хорошую цену и таким образом развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en: Matluba is a hardworking and kind woman.  She lives alone with her children since her husband is a migrant worker in another country.  He sends home money to his family when possible.  However, it is not enough.  She has four children.  Matluba is a homemaker.  Her husband fattened cattle to sell, and when he had to leave to work abroad, Matluba decided to continue his work.At the moment, Matluba has one cow that gives 10-12 liters of milk.  She sells dairy products to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Her oldest son helps her with feeding the cattle.  Matluba plans to save money to build a home for her oldest son so that after he marries, he won't need to worry about a thing.  In order to reach her goal, she works day and night.  Matluba is asking for a loan to buy another cow as well as fodder for her animals.  Having fattened up the cattle over a period of a few months, she plans to sell them for a good price which will help grow her business..

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
Улугбек отец  2 детей и любящий муж. Он разводит дома скот. У него большой дом и хозяйство.  Его семья поддерживает в развитии его хозяйства, они помогают  разводить скот. Каждые 5-6 месяцев Улугбек выводит готовых коров на рынок для продажи, а овец каждые  2 месяца. Также Улугбек кроме откорма скота , занимается и другим бизнесом, у него есть магазин по продаже продуктов и питания,но основной доход у него от откорма скота.  В его отсутствии его дети и жена ухаживают за скотом.
 Улугбек  запрашивает кредит для того, чтобы купить несколько голов скота и развивать свой бизнес. Он очень надеется на финансовую поддержку от Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Ulugbek is the father of two children and a loving husband.  He has a large home and farm where he breeds cattle.  His family supports the expansion of his business and they help raise the animals.  Ulugbek takes his cows to the market to sell every 5 to 6 months, and his sheep, every 2 months.  Besides fattening cattle, he runs another business, a store where he sells food products.  It's his work with livestock, however, that is the family's main source of income.  When Ulugbek is absent, his children and wife care for the livestock.  He is asking for a loan to buy a few head of cattle to expand his business.  He hopes for the financial support of Arvand and is grateful in advance.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: San Damian Group

texts.es:
El grupo se denomina  Padre Damian en homenaje a la capilla que lleva el mismo nombre, las integrantes están en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una tiene una gran esperanza de mejorar sus vidas con este desafío.
Marta, la presidenta, vende ropas de todas clases y marcas, ella misma dice que siempre tuvo buena habilidad para las ventas, y que por eso opto por este negocio. Con esfuerzo y lucha esta mejorando cada día, ya que de esa forma también ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan.
Hoy pide un crédito para poder invertirlo en prendas de otoño, ya que se acerca el cambio de estación y quiere poder tener una buena variedad que dar a sus clientes. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que ha recibido
texts.en:
The group is referred to as Padre Damian (Father Damian), paying tribute to the chapel of the same name.  The group members are in their 4th loan with the women's committee, where they all have great hope to improve their lives with this challenge.

Marta, the president, sells clothing of all types and brands.  She says that she has always been good in sales and it is due to this reason that she started this business.  With effort and struggle, she is improving every day, helping her family, and giving them what they need.

Today, she is asking for a loan in order to invest it in autumn clothing, since the change in season is coming up and she wants to have a good variety to give her customers.  She is very grateful for this opportunity that she has received.

loans.use: buy autumn clothing to sell.

loans.name: Union Y Amistad Group

texts.es: Doña Ofelia es parte del grupo Unión y Amistad es un grupo ubicado en los límites del estado de Michoacán con el Estado de México, en una zona Mazahua llena de vegetación donde de las personas de la comunidad cuidan y protegen los bosques de los talamontes. Ella tiene una cooperativa escolar desde hace 5 años en la telesecundaria de su comunidad, ella dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que está al pendiente de la comida de los muchachos de la escuela, dice que a diario ella les hace diferentes tipos de guisados y que una de sus hijas le ayuda a hacer los alimentos tanto para los maestros como para los alumnos. También les vende frituras, refrescos, aguas de sabores, golosinas,  las cuales va a comprar a la población de Zitacuaro ya que ahí le dan más económicos los artículos y varias refresqueras le van a surtir hasta su población, ella ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de los insumos que ocupa para hacer alimentos y fruta ya que también vende desayunos nutritivos como frutas con granola y yogurt, también quiere comprar platos nuevos para dar mejor presentación a la comida que vende, dice ella “la satisfacción que tengo al vender la comida es que los muchachos me buscan para que les de de almorzar nutritivamente y eso me llena de orgullo ya que hay gente que les viene a vender chucherías pero me son fieles" y ríe. Dice que su sueño es remodelar su negocio y poner unas bancas mas amplias para darle mejor servicio a los muchachos de la telesecundaria. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Lidia, Marisol, Fabián, Gilberta, Sandra y Juan Carlos ellos invertirán en sus créditos en compra de borregos y alimentos para cría y después venderlos, compra de ropa para bebe y dama para su venta, para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada, para la compra de suplementos alimenticios para su venta,
texts.en:
Doña Ofelia is part of the "Unión y Amistad" [Togetherness and Friendship] Group. It's a group located at the border of the Mexican states of Michoacán and México. It is a heavily vegetated indigenous Mazahua region where the people care for and protect the forests from gangs of illegal loggers. 

Doña Ofelia has had a school cooperative in her community's secondary school for five years. She says that she likes her work very much because she takes care of the meals for the kids in the school. She says that every day she makes them different types of stews and that one of her daughters helps her make the meals for both the students and the teachers. She also sells fried foods, cold drinks, flavored waters, and snacks, which she buys in the town of Zitacuaro, where she can buy them more cheaply; various soft-drink distributors deliver to her town. 

Now Ofelia is requesting a loan for the purchase of ingredients that she uses to make meals, as well as fruit, since she also sells nutritious breakfasts like fruit with granola and yogurt. She also wants to buy new plates so she can better present the food that she sells. She says, smiling, "the satisfaction I have in selling food is that the kids seek me out so I can give them a nutritious lunch, and that fills me with pride because there are people who come to sell junk food, but they are loyal to me." 

Ofelia says that her dream is to remodel her business and install larger benches to give better service to the kids at the secondary school. The other members of the group are named Lidia, Marisol, Fabián, Gilberta, Sandra, and Juan Carlos. They will invest their loans in the following: the purchase of sheep and feed for raising them for sale; the purchase of women's and children's clothing to sell; the purchase of seasonal fruits and vegetables; and the purchase of nutritional supplements to sell.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Realidad Group

texts.es: Doña Concepción tiene 51 años de edad  es originaria de una comunidad de Curungueo una localidad pintoresca, donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican al cultivo y venta de aguacate y al comercio, ella desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su casa ya que su esposo le acondiciono un local para que tuviera una entrada de dinero más para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios, dice que le gusta mucho su negocio porque lo tiene bien surtido y vende de todo un poco hasta juguetes y regalos, así como huaraches, refrescos, un poco de mercería. La mercancía la compra en la población cercana a la de ella llamada Zitacuaro, también dice que puso la tienda para que la gente de su comunidad no se trasladara a otros lugares a comprar lo necesario y para que no gastaran en pasajes es por eso que ella puso su tiendita. Conchita como es conocida está pidiendo un crédito para surtir su tienda de abarrotes y para surtir su mercería para que sus clientes no se vayan a otros lados a comprar. Ella agradece a VisionFund por el crédito que le harán ya que  tendrá su tienda mejor surtida. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Lidia, Francisco y María Raquel ellos invertirán en sus créditos para la compra de ropa usada para su venta y para la compra de colchas para vender, para la compra de flores para hacer arreglos florales, para surtir cosméticos de diferentes marcas para su venta.
texts.en:
Doña Concepción is 51 years old and is originally from the town of Curungueo, a picturesque town where most people work farming and selling avocados.  She has been selling groceries in her house for 18 years, ever since her husband set her up with a work space.  It allows them to have an additional income source to help pay for their children's education.

She says that she likes her business a lot because she keeps it well stocked and sells a little bit of everything, even toys and gifts.  She also sells sandals, soda, and sewing supplies.  She buys her sewing supplies in a village near hers called Zitacuaro.

She also says that they started their store so people in her community wouldn't have to travel to other towns to buy what they need and so they wouldn't have to spend money on travelling.

Conchita (the name she goes by) is asking for a loan to stock her grocery store and stock up on sewing supplies so her customers don't go to different places to buy them.

She is grateful to Vision Fund for the loan that she will give her, since she will be able to stock her store better.  The names of the other members of the group are Lidia, Francisco, and María Raquel.  They will invest what they obtain from loans to buy used clothing and bedspreads to sell, flowers to make flower arrangements, and also to stock up on different brands of cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: buy goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Afortunadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Afortunada es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, donde todas son amigas y vecinas de barrio, que se unieron para procurar un bien, no solo para ellas sino también para su comunidad. Hoy ya están en su ciclo dos, luchando por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Erma cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa en su casa, donde día a día se levanta a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas. Erma sueña con tener el día de mañana un gran negocio y poder dar una mayor comodidad a su familia, ya que por ellos lucha.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, frutas, verduras, carne, embutidos, leche y demás, ya que son los que mas salida y venta tienen y quiere poder surtirse bien para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group named Afortunada is from the city of Paraguarí, where they are all friends and neighbors.  They came together to accomplish good, not only for themselves but also for their community.  Today they are on their second loan and striving to get ahead.

One of the members is Erma.  She says that she has a small grocery store within her house where day after day she gets up to work, starting very early in the morning.  Erma dreams of eventually having a large business and being able to make the lives of her family more comfortable.  She works on their behalf.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy drinks, fruit, vegetables, meat, snacks, and milk, among other things.  These are the things that she sells the most and she wants to stock up well for her customers.

loans.use: buy drinks, fruit, vegetables, meat, snacks, milk, etc.

loans.name: Hilda Del Rosarío

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. vive junto a su esposo que trabaja  en el ingenio en la temporada de zafra (noviembre a mayo) y en la agricultura cultivando maíz en los meses de junio a noviembre. Su casa la ha construido en terreno del estado.

Ella se dedica a preparar tamales en promedio 275 por semana y los vende a los vecinos; también, hace tamales cuando le hacen encargos de personas que realizan funerales en la zona. El vivir a Oria de calle le permite vender golosinas, refrescos, sodas, y recargas o venta de saldo para teléfonos celulares. Esto lo hace desde hace más de 15 años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar madera y  1000 tejas de barro para construir el nuevo techo de su vivienda.

Con la inversión, podrá elaborar del techo de su vivienda, para resguardar sus pertenencias y protegerse en la época lluviosa y evitar el exceso de  humedad dentro de la vivienda que permita un ambiente propicio para el desarrollo de enfermedades y de insectos que perjudiquen la salud de la familia.

Su deseo es, ampliar la oferta de productos y formalizar una tienda en su casa, apoyar a sus hijos en la compra de terrenos para que puedan construir sus viviendas.
texts.en:
Hilda is 46 years old. She is married and has three children. Hilda lives with her husband, who works in a sugar factory during the cane-cutting season (November to May) and in the fields growing corn during the months from June to November. Their house was built on land the government gave them. 

Hilda earns a living making and selling tamales. She averages 275 per week, which she sells to her neighbors. She also prepares tamales when customers order them for funerals in her region. Living on the edge of the street permits her to sell candy, sodas, juices, and pay-as-you-go cell phone credit. She has been working like this for over 15 years. 

Hilda is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy wood and 1000 ceramic tiles to build a new roof for her home. With this investment, she will be able to create a new roof to protect her belongings and provide protection during the rainy season that will keep it drier inside the house. This helps keep her home less susceptible to illnesses and insects that can damage her family's health. 

Hilda's goal is to expand the variety of products she sells and formalize a shop in her house as well as support her children as they buy land on which to build their own houses.

loans.use: to buy wood and 1000 ceramic tiles to build a new roof for her home.

loans.name: Mariamu's Group

texts.en:
Mariamu is a 34-year-old mother of seven children. 

She is a dryland farmer. Her agricultural work is very tiresome and difficult when she has to work while hungry. Mariamu has heard from other KOMAZA tree farmers, that she can make money from her trees, so she is joining the micro-forestry program to earn an income to pay school fees, and to start a trading business.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance and support.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Even though Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells cocoa porridge in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she started ten years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their three children. 

Ekua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. She aims to use her loan to purchase more cocoa, indirectly helping her make more porridge to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business,  Ekua wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more cocoa, indirectly helping her make more porridge to sell.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth lives in the Litein area of Kenya, in the hills south of Rift Valley. She has two children and has been involved in farming work for six years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Getting profits from farming business". Her biggest challenge is "animal diseases". The animal in the farm is named "Tuiya". She will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

Janeth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They assist farmers through group management training'. This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They give loans to smallholders.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Janeth replied 'It will improve the family living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Janeth owns the following: 'cow and poultry', but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds for her farming business.

loans.name: Bendera's Group

texts.en:
Bendera is a 40-year-old mother of six children and is a businesswoman. She makes and sells mandazi, a local baked good, in the nearest trading centre. However, she does not have enough money to expand her baking business. 

Bendera is planting a tree farm because she says, "KOMAZA is doing development and I also want to develop, just like my neighbors who have joined."

She intends to use the profits to educate her children and support them if they are accepted to a university some day. Bendera would also like to build a house for her family with the money from her tree farm.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance and support.

loans.name: Sigei

texts.en:
Sigei lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He lives with his children in their rural home where he has been carrying out a farming business for five years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "milking dairy cows". His biggest challenge is animal diseases and the high cost of feed during dry seasons. The animal in the farm is named "Lelmet". He will use the loan of 25,000 KES from Kiva's partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds.

Sigei was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Their rates are fair'. This client was also asked what he learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Loans are good.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Sigei replied, 'it will improve the living standards.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Sigei owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds for his farming business.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 39-year-old father of six children, and is a businessman. He keeps poultry, and grows maize, cowpeas and cassava. Richard's chickens are affected by diseases and he lacks the capital to purchase medicine. 

He is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that he can use the profits from his tree farm to dig a borehole for a constant water supply and build a home for his family. 

Richard says about KOMAZA, "It is an organization that is working with the community and they are truthful. My kids can have an opportunity to get the best education, and I will have money to invest." 

Also pictured with the group of five is Maju, who is already a KOMAZA-Kiva farmer with another group.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance and support.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Makina Group

texts.en:
Chrispinus is pictured on the right with his hand raised, amongst his Makina Group members. The 17 of them, 9 women and 8 men, are farmers in Teso District. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to Chrispinus on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant half an acre of millet, sweet potatoes and sorghum. Chrispinus first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Chrispinus joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and grow enough to feed his family.

Chrispinus reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 3 bags of maize per ½ acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 8 bags per ½ acre! He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and perhaps invest in another business. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Chrispinus' group will receive 8.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of millet, sweet potatoes, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kahindi's Group

texts.en:
Kahindi is a forty-four-year-old single father of six children. He earns money through various businesses, including masonry work, farming, community work as a group mobilizer and traditional musician. 

Drought makes dryland farming difficult and group dynamics pose a challenge to group cohesion for his community work. 

He is investing in the KOMAZA micro-forestry program as savings for his children's future. He will use the profits from his tree farm to educate his children, two of whom are already in school.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a member of the Mwangaza Group in Teso District. She is pictured with 11 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 4 men. Hellen is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. She is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season.  She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and will use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Hellen thought her harvest last year was poor. She hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer she can have an excellent harvest. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to buy cattle. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Hellen’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.  

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Marcy Group

texts.en:
Marcy is a group of 10 farmers in Teso District represented by Stephen. The group has 2 women and 8 men. Stephen is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum. Stephen is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and will use the increased profits to send his children to school.

Stephen thought his harvest last year was poor.  He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he can have an excellent harvest. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Stephen’s group will receive a total of 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The Field Officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Elvis Gonzalo

texts.es: Elvis Gonzalo es un joven soltero de 24 años, es propietario de una pequeña pulpería ubicada en el departamento de Chinandega, que heredo de parte de su abuelita, desde muy chico conocio el negocio de la familia, ya que el dice que ayudaba a ordenar los productos, le fue tomando cariño a este negocio y cuando queda a su cargo comienza a administrarlo, he poco a poco ha ido surtiendo esta pequeña pulpería la cual vende productos al consumidor como arroz, sal, café, azúcar, fosforos, avena, aceite, golosinas, productos helados, gaseosas, entre otros productos mas, el esta solicitando financiamiento para invertir mas en su capital de trabajo en incrementar su inventario de productos ya que en esta temporada siempre tiene demanda y sus clientes han ido creciendo.
texts.en:
Elvis Gonzalo is 24 years old and single.  He is the owner of a small grocery store located in the Chinandega department.  He inherited it from his grandmother.  Since he was young, he learned the family business and helped organize the products and took care of the store.  Since it became his responsibility to run the store, he has slowly begun to stock the small store.  He sells products such as rice, salt, coffee, sugar, matches, oats, oil, sweets, frozen products, sodas, and others.  

He is requesting this loan to invest in his working capital to increase his inventory of products since he always has demand this time of year and his number of customers is growing.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sugar, rice, beans, oil, dairy products, sweets, and other items.

loans.name: Polvon

texts.ru:
Полвон запрашивает  кредит, чтобы  развить свой бизнес по откорму скота. Он содержит дома скот. Полвон хочет увеличить свой капитал за счет продажи скота. Его жена домохозяйка, но она помогает ухаживать за скотом. Она также продает молоко и различные молочные продукты. Таким образом  она помогает своей семье  изменить жизнь в лучшую сторону. Это их единственный доход в семье.
 В настоящее время  Полвон хочет получить кредит, что бы приобрести скот. В бизнесе помогает его старший сын . Полвон  мечтает, чтобы его сын развивал скотоводство и в будущем построил дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Polvon is seeking a loan in order to develop his cattle-fattening business. He raises cattle at home, and he wants to increase his capital by selling cows. His wife is a homemaker, and she assists in looking after the cattle. She also sells milk and various dairy products. In this way, she is helping to change the family's living standard for the better. This is the only source of income for the family. Now Polvon wants a loan so he can buy cattle. His eldest son helps him in this business, and Polvon's dream is for his son to further develop their animal husbandry activities, and in the future build a house for his own family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 44, lives with her partner, Joshua, in Msambweni. They both work in retail trades. Irene has a well-stocked store which enables her to earn a living. In her store she sells vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, onions and consumer staples. Irene is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve her quality of life.

Irene will use this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, potatoes, etc. She thanks Yehu Microfinance and Kiva for the assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Akiduku Group

texts.en:
Roselyne is pictured on the right with her hand raised among her Akiduku Group members. The 12 of them, 9 women and 3 men, are farmers in Teso District.  Farming inputs will be delivered to Roselyne on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum. She joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. She joined One Acre Fund so that she could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Roselyne described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and to save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Roselyne’s group will receive 6 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Walter is a member of the Mavuno Group in Teso District. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 3 men. Walter is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Walter joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. He joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Walter described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Walter’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Lissett De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lissett de los Angeles, 47 años de edad casada dos hijos, ella es originaria del municipio de Chinandega, Ubicado en el occidente del país, Lissette siempre ha trabajado desde muy joven, a hora con sus ahorros logra invertir en una pulpería pero también con poco inventario ella saca adelante una pequeña inversión que hace en la compra de una paca de ropa usada, logrando obtener dos pequeños negocios pero accesibles para sus clientes, con muchos esfuerzos, ha ido superando diversos tropiezos que se la han presentado, uno de sus sueños es poder realizar algunas mejoras que le faltan en su hogar al igual que lograr poner su tienda de ropa usada y no tener que ir alquilar ya que este ha ido creciendo y tiene mayor demanda, ella esta solicitando financiamiento para invertir en su pulpería y también acondicionar mejor este local.
texts.en:
Lissett de los Angeles is 47 years old, married, and has two children.  She is originally from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  Lissette has worked since she was very young.  With her savings, she was able to invest in a grocery store, but she also made a small investment in a purchase of a bundle of used clothing.  This allows her to have two small businesses that are accessible to her customers.  With a lot of effort, she has been able to overcome various obstacles that faced her.  One of her dreams is to be able to make some improvements on her home so that she can put her used clothing store there and not have to rent space, since it has been growing and has more demand.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in her grocery store and also make improvements to that space.

loans.use: to invest in her two businesses: a grocery store and used clothing sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Mavuno Group is located in Teso District.  It is a group of 8 women and 3 men led by Kefa, who is pictured on the right with his hand raised.   He is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum cultivation. Kefa joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season.  He joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Kefa described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Kefa’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 5.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Akimorasit Group

texts.en:
Pamela is pictured on the right with her hand raised among her Akimorasit Group members.  The 10 of them, 6 women and 4 men, are farmers in the Teso District.   Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum. Pamela is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season.  She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Pamela thought her harvest last year was poor. She hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer she can have an excellent harvest. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and buy cattle. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Pamela’s group will receive a total of 5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Akichasit Group

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of Akichasit Group in Teso District. She is pictured with 20 One Acre Fund farmers, 11 women and 9 men.  Joyce is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of Sweet Potato, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Joyce is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Joyce described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Joyce’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each.  In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potatoes, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Abduvohid

texts.ru:
Абдувохид обратился в МДО «Арванд» для получения кредита, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Он содержит дома несколько голов скота. Эта основная его работа, в их регионе откорм скота и выращивание сельскохозяйственной  культуры являются очень актуальными, поэтому он всерьез занимается этим делом, что бы прокормит свою семью.
  У него большая семья и ему трудно одному, многие соседи  уезжают в Россию на заработки, но Абдувохид не хочет оставлять  свою семью и уезжать  в чужую страну и старается здесь на родине зарабатывать денежные средства и кормить свою семью. 
На полученный кредит Абдувохид планирует купить несколько голов скота и расширить свой бизнес. Очень надеется на финансовую поддержку со стороны Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Abduvohid has approached MDO "Arvand" for a loan so he can increase his herd. He keeps several head of cattle at home, and this is his main work. The region where he lives is well-suited to fattening cattle and growing crops, and he has channeled serious efforts into this business so he can feed his family. He has a large family and it is difficult for him to provide for them on his own. Many of his neighbours have gone to Russia as migrant workers, but Abduvohid does not want to leave his family to go to a foreign land, which is why he is trying to earn enough income to take care of them while remaining at home. He plans to use the loan to buy more cattle and expand his business. He is really hoping for financial support from Arvand, and thanks all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a power washer, a trailer and a cooking stove and warming table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise, display cases and lighting for their new storefront.

loans.name: Akimorikina Group

texts.en:
Akimorikina is a group of 20 farmers in Teso district represented by Kamil. The group has 14 women and six men. 

Kamil is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a half acre of sweet potato, millet and sorghum. 

Kamil is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and grow enough food for the family.

Kamil thought his harvest last year was poor. He hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer he can have an excellent harvest. He hopes that his profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send his children to school and buy cattle. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive a half acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Kamil’s group will receive 10 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of sweet potato, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Kahaso's Group

texts.en:
Kahaso is a 26-year-old dryland farmer and mother of three children. Her husband is also a farmer, but there is not enough food during the time of farm preparation to provide energy for their work and they do not have the capital to purchase quality inputs such as seeds. 

Kahaso decided to join the KOMAZA microforestry program after seeing the trees growing well and she was also convinced by KOMAZA farmers. 

She intends to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children and buy quality seeds for her farming.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice thanks her business and also the previous Kiva loan, which helped her to buy clothes for sale. It earned her good profit. She aspires to expand her business, which will enable her create job opportunities for young people.

She again appeals to you requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to buy new clothes for sale. She appreciates for your great help.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.ru:
Расулчон добрый и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат и имеет детей. Он со своей семьей живут среди гор. Расулчон и его жена занимаются скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности они занимаются уже несколько лет. Расулчон каждые две недели покупает скот,откормив, через некоторое время продает на том же рынке за выгодную цену. Этот бизнес дает очень хороший доход. 
 Недавно от знакомых узнав о кредите,  он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит для развития своего бизнеса.  Расулчон мечтает чтобы  его дети поступили в хороший ВУЗ, и получали хорошее образование, для этого ему необходимо накопить определенную сумму. 
 Получив кредит он приобретет  скот и планирует увеличить с каждым разом свой капитал.
texts.en: Rasuljon is a kind and hard-working man. He is married and has children. He and his family live in the mountains, where he and his wife work in animal husbandry. They have been doing this for several years already. Every 2 weeks, Rasuljon buys cattle, fattens them, and after some time sells them at the same market for a profit. This business brings in a very good income. Having recently heard about the possibility of a loan from acquaintances, Rasuljon has approached Arvand in order to develop his business. His dream is for his children to receive a good education at a post-secondary institution, and to make this happen, he needs to save up a certain amount of money. He plans to use the loan to purchase cattle, and with each sale, to set aside more savings.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has five children and is a resident of Litein area, South Rift,  Kenya. For the past 12 years, she has been a farmer and her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and tea. Jane states that what she finds most enjoyable about farming is "grazing cows!" and her biggest challenge is "dairy feeds." One of her animals has been named Karoi. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for her loan, she replied, their "grace period." Jane was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session and replied: "it processes loans." Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.  

Jane is requesting a loan to set up a greenhouse. When asked how her loan will benefit her family, she replied, "more income." As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns a "cow " but does not own a "pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, or automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on their loans. Jane has "a mosquito net" but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD." 

To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository. This reduces paper use and makes the process more efficient which keeps costs down.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: J.d'amour

texts.en:
J.d'amour is a 35-year-old man from Ngororero District in the Western Province of Rwanda. He started selling lights in September 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. J.d'amour is also a farmer.

J.d'amour is requesting a 50 USD loan to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights that he will resell to people in his village who are without electricity. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 20 cents. J.d'amour will use the profit from his loan to expand his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife, and their children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Joan
