Sharaly sells a variety of electronic products, which he stores in the local market. He began working this way over 7 years ago because he needed to earn money. Currently, his cousin helps him to purchase his merchandise. 

This is his ninth loan with IMON, and he is grateful for its financial support in helping him to realize his plans. He is asking for a loan of $3,000 USD to buy goods for widening the assortment of his merchandise. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy products to widen the assortment of the goods he sells

loans.name: Hadie

texts.en:
She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. Hadie is asking for another Kiva loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers. 

She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice and other products to stock her cafe.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 24 years old. He is single and has been a motorcyclist for two years. 

He has requested a loan to make preparation of his motorbike for ease of use in the transport of passengers. He plans to use the profits for buying a plot of land, on which he will build a house.

loans.use: to make preparation of his motorbike for ease of use in the transport of passengers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and material for work.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa's dream has always been to have a well-supplied general store in order to be able to generate more income and thus be able to have a better quality of life for her and her whole family. With her effort, work and dedication she succeeded, reaching her goals without any type of problem. Today, she has the shop she dreamed of and she is requesting this loan in order to be able to supply it with drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: able to supply her shop with drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Kwale county, in southern Kenya. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passionfruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

James has been farming for 45 years and is currently growing oranges on his land. He is married with six children and his wife is currently retired. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because he trusts their Hive Technicians to visit his farm regularly and to do good work repairing the hives and harvesting honey.

This is James' first Kiva loan and he plans to use the extra income generated from his hives to buy materials to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is married and has five children who go to school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water, and her greatest expense is food.

Zainabu has a food stall, and she wants to expand her business to have a better range of customers and satisfy their needs. That is why she is asking for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy beans, vegetable oil, wheat flour, and rice to give a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beans, vegetable oil, wheat flour, and rice.

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is 51 years old. He lives in Borjomi district with his 51-year-old wife, Eter and 28-year-old son, Dimitri. Vazha requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is from real estate. Vazha owns a commercial space in the center of Borjomi which is rented. However, the rental amount is not enough to cover the family's monthly expenses. 

Vazha requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. His loan request was approved through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan programs envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products and being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Vazha will purchase a truck. He already has collected most of the amount and is missing part of it for purchasing. He will be working on transporting different kinds of cargo and earn additional income for the family. This will help them to cover all the monthly expenses and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 45 years old. She is a widow with six children, five of whom attend school. She's been selling beers and sodas for a period of seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beers and sodas for sale. She is planning to use the profits for reinvesting in the bar business because she has seen that the demand for alcohol is high.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas for sale.

loans.name: Priscille

texts.en:
Priscille is 30 years old. She is married with three children.

With the loan, she wants to add more foodstuffs for sale such as rice, cooking oil, salt, and soaps. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more retail items such as soaps, cooking oil and salt to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has two children. She owns a house with electricity but without piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and her children's school fees.

She has a vegetable stall and she is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy sacks of onions, cabbages, potatoes, fruits and kale for sale to meet the needs of her customers and satisfy the needs of her family from the cash she gets after the sales.

loans.use: to buy sacks of onions, cabbages, potatoes, fruits and kale for sale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives and farms in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, and is the southernmost Kenyan county. Though some of the towns along the beach see benefits from tourism, the majority of people living inland are farmers, and the region's inconsistent rains can make agricultural yields unpredictable. Beekeeping is a relatively new activity in the area, but many farmers here are enthusiastic at the prospect of owning their own hives and gathering additional income from the sale of their honey.

Faith is married, and has four children. Her husband is also a farmer, and they are currently nurturing a tree plantation on their land. Faith has been farming for thirty-five years, and is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper, as she enjoys eating honey. She wants to work with Honey Care Africa because their hives are well made and their hive technicians give great service.

This is Faith's first loan, and she plans to use the extra income generated from her hives to build additions to her house. In the future, she hopes to invest in her land and expand her farming activities.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack lives and farms in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps close to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Isaack is excited to work with Honey Care, as he thinks their Hive Technicians give good service, and he is happy to be a beekeeper because he enjoys eating honey. He has been farming for fifty-six years, and is currently growing oranges on his land. He is married, and his wife currently works as a housekeeper. He and his wife have nine children, and plan to use some of the income generated from their hives to pay for school fees. 

This is Isaack's first Kiva loan. In the future, he hopes to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Kazar

texts.en:
Kazar is 29 years old. He lives in Ninotsminda District with his 26-year-old wife, two children (twins), parents and two sisters. Kazar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions.

Kazar is working in a factory where graves and funeral flowers are produced. That’s the only income for the family and it’s not enough to satisfy their daily needs.

Kazar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Kazar will purchase materials for producing graves and making funeral flowers. As he is already working in this business, he is very experienced and decided to start his own one. He is already well known among the villagers and will have his own clients. This will help him to earn additional income and make a good profit. Part of the profit he will use for reinvesting in the same business and another part for providing better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for producing graves and making funeral flowers

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has six children. She owns a house without electricity or piped water, and her greatest expense is food.

She sells vegetables and fruits in her grocery store to earn a living.  She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers so that she can increase her income in order to help her boost the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en: Mireille is 29-years-old. She has three children and they all go to school. She sells food items and has been in the business for 10 years. She wants the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be purposely reinvested in the business. She is very happy that the previous loan helped a lot in upgrading her store.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a resident of Litein South Rift Kenya. He has three children and has been farming for nine years. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, and tea.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Fencing!" His biggest challenge is "ploughing season." One of his animals is named Seker. He has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a chuff cutter. He says this will help ease the feeding of the dairy cows.

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Good loan terms."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "It gives small loans to farmers without much securities."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Paul replied, "It will earn me more income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns the following: "cow, poultry, motorcycle" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in his household "mosquito net, running water" but does not have "electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a chuff-cutter

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in Magondi, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passionfruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Samuel is married and has nine children. He has been farming for 50 years and is currently growing cashew nuts. He is excited to work with Honey Care Africa because they handle hive inspections and harvesting so he doesn't have to get stung by bees. This is Samuel's first loan and he hopes to use the income generated from his hives to help build a new house.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Ratifa

texts.en:
Ratifa is 29 years old. She owns a bar and has been running the bar for 2 years. She is married and blessed with one child aged 5.

She has requested the loan to add more and different types of beers and soft drinks for sale. The profits from the business will be used mainly for buying a plot of land for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy more and different types of beers for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Elizabeth is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling women's jewelry in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Elizabeth is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Elizabeth wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell a greater quantity of her jewelry. In the long term, Elizabeth plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels to sell a greater quantity of her jewelry.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 60 years old. She is a widow and has two children. She sells beans but she has requested a loan to buy a motorbike to use and to become a source of income. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Doh

texts.en: Doh sells plastic wares in Ve-gbodome, Hohoe and its surrounding areas.  Doh has received the basic middle level education.  She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a Farmer. Doh has been selling plastic wares for the past 5 years. She assists her husband with the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic wares and increase her working capital. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more plastic bowls that will enable her to save enough money to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy more plastic wares

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Rose is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cooking ingredients near Cape Coast in Ghana. She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. 

Rose is married and has six children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses, and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Rose will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cooking ingredients, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cooking ingredients, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 35-years-old. She is married and has six children. She sells animals and has been in the business for four years. With the loan, Esperance wants to buy more cattle for slaughter and sell meat. Esperance wants to use the profits from the business to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for slaughter and to sell meat

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija, is married and has three school going children.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water, and her greatest expense is food for her children.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES to buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, baking powder and rice to enable her to cook food for her customers and increase her business

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, baking powder and rice

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a trader who deals in the sales of smoked fish and fried fish at Ve-gbodome, Hohoe.  Regina has received a primary school level education.  She is divorced and has 3 children with her husband. For the past 9 years, Regina has been in the petty trading business to help herself and her family. She is responsible for the general support of her children and herself. Her loan will be used to buy cartons of fish and gallons of oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business. She hopes to increase her profits and save this money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish and gallons of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en:
Berthe, 58, is married and has two children aged thirteen and 27. For the past three years she has sold clothes to earn an income.

Berthe is applying for a 300,000 RWF loan from Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy additional clothes to sell. She plans to reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married to a peasant farmer and has 5 children. She has received schooling from basic school to middle school level. Grace is a food vendor who cooks and sells waakye at Ve-gbodome, Hohoe, which she has done for 8 years. 

Wakye is a traditional and very popular Ghanaian rice dish. It is often times eaten as breakfast, lunch or supper. To prepare waakye, she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish colour. Then, she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender to eat. Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomato sauce, fish, or meat. 

Grace uses her income to supply for the basic needs of her family and her younger siblings. Grace will use the loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and gallons of oil. With the profits from her sales, Grace plans to save to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans, and gallons of oil

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en: Memuna is single and has 4 children. After successfully graduating from senior high school, Memuna is now an established businesswoman. She works as both a dressmaker & prepares and sells Accra Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in both businesses for about 5 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Memuna uses her income to provide for the entire family. Memuna will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of dresses and maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales for both businesses. With the new profits from her expanded businesses, Memuna plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of dresses and maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 26 years old. She sells clothes and has been in this business for two years. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes, especially for ladies, to sell. The profits from her business will be used to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with five children and has never been to school. Her husband is a farmer. For the past ten years she has sold cereals and grains in Gbodome near Hohoe to help feed the family and pay their utility bills.

Victoria is applying for a 1000 GHS loan through CRAN to buy a variety of grains from local markets, then sell them at a profit in larger towns. With greater earnings from her business, Victoria plans to save for her family basic needs and future growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grains to sell in bigger towns.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married and has 7 children. She has received schooling through a middle school level. Rose is a fish monger and also prepares and sells palm oil in Ve-gbodome, in the Hohoe community, which she has been doing for 10 years. Her husband is a mason. Rose uses her income for assisting her husband to cater to their children's general needs. Rose will use the loan to purchase palm fruits and also cartons of fish to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to save so she can increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits and also cartons of fish

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 33-years-old. She sells animals which they slaughter for meat sale. She is married and has eight children. She wants the loan to buy more cows to sell. She is planning to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina sells Accra Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Paulina has been working in this enterprise for almost a year. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her Kenkey enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en: Gloriose is 29. She is married with two children. She sells wine and other alcoholic drinks. She wants to buy more wine to sell. She plans to use the profit for expanding the volume of her business.

loans.use: To buy more wine to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 36 years old. She is married with six children aged between one and fifteen. Only four go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, sugar and corn flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and corn flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married, has six children and went through junior high school. While his wife is a seamstress, he is mainly responsible for the general support of his family.

For the past eight years Thomas has dealt in building materials in Gbodome near Hohoe. He is applying for a 1500 GHS loan from CRAN to buy more rebar and cement to sell. With greater profits from his business, Thomas plans to save for his children's school fees and other potential needs.

loans.use: to buy more rebar and cement to sell.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married, has four children and was educated through middle school. Her husband is a driver.

Esi is a small-scale fish monger in Akatakyiwa near Cape Coast. For quite some time now she has bought fish from a nearby fishing village and then smoked it to sell. She uses her earnings to help pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees.

Esi is applying for a 500 GHS loan from CRAN to buy an increased quantity of fish to smoke, thus allowing her to meet customers’ rising demands. She hopes to use her new profits to set up a smoked fish stand so she can sell from a permanent location.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Aldona

texts.en:
This loan will help Aldona expand her towing company and be able to sign Sarasota City contracts.

Aldona has moved from Poland to Brooklyn, and most recently, to Sarasota, Florida. Yet, despite her many moves, the one constant in her life has been her passion for the towing industry. “I love helping people who are in need, and with my strong character, I needed a business that challenged me,” Aldona says. 

Aldona began her own company, Fastway Towing and Recovery LLC, in 2009. Fastway Towing offers 24-hour service, seven days a week. You can visit Aldona’s website at: http://fastwaytowing.wix.com/florida 

Aldona is now looking to expand her business. She needs a loan to purchase additional yard space and equipment so she can sign a contract with the Sarasota Sheriff’s program, which would increase her income by more than 75%. In addition, Aldona also plans to purchase repossession insurance in order to qualify her business to receive work from banks, dealerships and buy here/pay here lots, which would significantly increase her company’s revenue. Aldona would also like to register and insure her rollback wrecker, which would enable her to hire an employee and help create jobs within her community.

loans.use: to purchase yard space and equipment, to buy repossession insurance, and to register and insure her rollback wrecker.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 23 years old and married. She has one child who is one and a half years old.

For the past year Justine has sold different sorts of food. She is applying for a 600000 RWF loan from Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy more maize flour and beer to sell. Her ambition is to use her profits to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour and beer to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married and has five children. She was educated up to junior high school level. Her husband is a farmer.

Since 2007 Patience has been cooking and selling rice and beans at the market square in Gbodome Township near Hohoe. She uses her profits to help support her home and family.

Patience is applying for a 600 GHS loan from CRAN to buy additional bags of rice and beans. She hopes to save and use her new earnings to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice and beans.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling till the end of junior high school. Christina sells Waakye (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves) at Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this business for about 2 years. Her husband is a carpenter. Christina uses her income to support her husband in raising their 2 children. Christina will use the loan to purchase more rice and beans, thus helping her prepare more Waakye. With the new profits from her expanded business, Christina plans to expand her enterprise into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans, thus helping her prepare more Waakye

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a small scale fish monger in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She purchases her fish from a nearby fishing village and smokes it for resale. Aba has has not had any form of formal education.  She is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Aba has been selling smoked fish for 22 years.  Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish to smoke, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of setting up a smoked fish stand, so that she can sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish to smoke, thus allowing her to meet customers’ demands.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves) in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has not had any form of formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Mary has been working in this enterprise for almost a year. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of maize. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her kenkey enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Humphery

texts.en: Humphery is married and has four children. He has received schooling through basic school to the O level. Humphery is a food stuffs dealer - a middle man at Ve-gbodome, Hohoe - which he has done for 11 years now. His wife is a petty trader also at Ve-gbodome. Humphery is responsible for all the financial needs of the family. Humphery will use the loan to purchase more food stuffs from the local farmers to sell to market women in the big towns. With the new profits from his expanded business, Humphery plans to save enough to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs from local farmers

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, it has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells cassava and sugar cane in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began four years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their two children. 

Efua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her products. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more cassava and sugar cane to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and sugar cane to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is a local herbalist who produces and sells herbal medicine in Ve-gbodome, Hohoe Township. Felicia has received basic education to primary 4.  She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a pastor. Felicia has been producing and selling herbal medicine since 2009. She assists her husband to cater for their family's needs. Her loan will be used to buy herbs and bottles. She hopes to save and use the new profits from her business to improve upon the business.

loans.use: to buy herbs and bottles for her herbal medicine business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence sells provisions at Ve-gbodome, Hohoe.  She is divorced and has two children.  Florence is a disable woman and decided to sell to make ends meet after her divorced.  She has been in the provisions business for 5years. 

Florence is responsible for her general financial upkeep and that of her children. Her loan will be used to buy purchase packets of biscuits, Milo, candies, and milk.  She is also engaged in a trading business.  Florence hopes to save her profits for her old age.

loans.use: to buy purchase packets of biscuits, Milo, candies, and milk and also deals into other petty trading business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a widow and has two children. After successfully graduating senior high school, Veronica is now an established businesswoman. She prepares and sells gari (a traditional Ghanaian snack better known to the rest of the world as couscous) in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about one year. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Veronica uses her income to provide for her entire family. Veronica will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of gari, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Veronica plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of gari (couscous), thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Kpetsi

texts.en:
Kpetsi sells mother-related care products for the people of Ve-gbodome, Hohoe.  She has received a sixth grade education.  Kpetsi is divorced and has two children and two dependents. 

Kpetsi has been selling care products for two years.  She is responsible for the general upkeep of herself and her children.  

Her loan will be used to buy more mother care products such as pampers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her capital and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more mother care products such as pampers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Although she has received formal education, Agnes is an entrepreneur.  She specializes in selling frozen chicken in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast).  She has been involved in this enterprise for a year. 

Agnes is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a corn miller. 

The proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Agnes will use the loan to increase her storage capacity, and this will help improve her sales.  With the new profits, Agnes plans to expand her enterprise and increase her savings.

loans.use: to increase her storage capacity.

loans.name: Ayisha

texts.en:
Ayisha is a petty trader who sells in the Hohoe market.  Ayisha has received a junior high school education.   She is married and has two children.  Ayisha has been in business since 2006.

Her husband is a butcher.   She helps to take care of family expenses.

Ayisha's loan will be used to increase her working capital and enable her buy more cartons of tomatoes and fish.  She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyuntsetseg, 50, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Using her previous loan, the family finished building their house. She and her husband have been running a recycling materials collection point for 16 years and accumulated a vast amount of experience through this business. 

This time she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase necessary insulation and decoration materials for her house. Using those materials, she wants to insulate the house walls with fiber glass and foam and decorate the outer sides of house with bricks. This renovation will make the house an attractive and heat preserving place. More importantly, insulation will help the family burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is one of our trustworthy clients and paid her previous loans on an established schedule without delay.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and decoration materials for her new home

loans.name: Gloria 1, 2, 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Violeta is the coordinator of her group called Gloria (Glory). This group is compounded mostly by Haitian citizens. Her group is located in the areas surrounding San Pedro, a poor area where the economy used to thrive on sugar cane but has more recently waned, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children. Violeta is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing more clothes, shoes and cosmetic products. She will use the profits to save and improve her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is single and has six children.  Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells used clothing in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). She has been in business for three years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family.  

Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of used clothes, thus allowing her to improve her overall sales.  With the new profits Ama plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, and adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes.

loans.name: Confianza En Dios 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Melania is one of the members of the Confianza en Dios 1, 2, 3 & 4 group, which is located in the resort city of La Romana, in one of the communities without many resources. It is surrounded by sugarcane fields, also called batey. A majority of the inhabitants are Haitian immigrants who came to the Dominican Republic to improve their quality of life.

She is a dedicated mother who has eight children who live with her and her long-term partner. She has done different jobs to help her husband with the household necessities and bring in extra income. She wants to accomplish one of her most difficult goals - to have her own home.

Melania is very excited to receive her second loan with Esperanza International. She will invest the loan in purchasing different types of clothing for women and men, cosmetics, and especially women's accessories. She has worked in selling clothing for many years and with this loan, she plans to grow her business by adding different products to bring it to another level. She can then use her profits to make changes in her life, including saving money, purchasing a house, and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is married woman with two children.  She has received basic schooling but was not able to continue due to financial constrains. 

Hawa has been a food vendor for 16 years.  She cooks and sells waakye in her locality.  Wakye is a traditional rice dish in Ghana. To prepare wakye, she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds colored leaves to give them a reddish colour. Then, she adds rice and beans.  She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender to eat.  Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomatoes sauce, fish, or meat.

Her husband is a farmer.  Hawa uses her income to help cover the cost of family expenses.  

Hawa will use the loan to buy bags of rice, beans, tin tomatoes, and gallon of oil.  With the new profits Hawa plans to expand her business and save for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, beans, tomatoes, and oil.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a seamstress and she also sells cooking utensils in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). 

Her earnings help support her family and three children.  Esther's husband is a carpenter.

She has sold cooking utensils and sewn clothes for women for two years. 

Esther plans to use her loan to purchase cooking utensils and cloth.  She thinks this will help her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. 

Esther aspires to use her profits, to market her cooking utensils and seamstress business while increasing her working capital.   She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils and cloth.

loans.name: Asibi

texts.en:
Asibi is married and has five children and seven dependents.  She has never had a formal education. 

Asibi sells grains and she is also a seamstress and has been in business for six years. Her husband is a butcher. 

Asibi uses her income to cater to her children's schooling and basic needs. 

Asibi will use the loan to purchase cloths to sells to her customers and to buy linen for sewing.  With the new profits, Asibi plans to acquire a shop.

loans.use: to purchase cloths to sells to her customers and to buy linen for sewing.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice operates a grocery shop in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast).  She has received and education through junior high school.  She is married and has two children. 

Her husband is a teacher.  Eunice helps and care for their two children. 

Her loan will be used to buy a variety of groceries for sale.  Eunice hopes to reinvest the profits into her business, and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries for sale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama sells grains and groundnut paste in the Hohoe market square.  She is married and has a child.  Her husband is a teacher. 

Mariama has been selling grains and groundnut paste for five years.  She helps pay for the basic needs of her family.  

Her loan will be used to buy bags of groundnuts from the local market rather than from middle men and women.  She hopes to use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of groundnuts.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is single and has three children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Evelyn is now an established businesswoman. She sells clothes (primarily dresses, jeans and shirts) in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast).  She has been actively involved in this business for about a year. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Evelyn uses her income to provide for the entire family.  

Evelyn will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of clothes, thus aiding her to her overall sales.  With the new profits, Evelyn plans to diversify the type of products she sells so she can adapt to changing customers preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of clothes.

loans.name: Fuseini

texts.en:
Fuseini prepares and sells groundnut paste.  She has never received a basic education because her parent didn’t see any reason for girls to get educated.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a butcher. 

Fuseini has been in business for four years.  She helps pay for the basic needs of her family. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of groundnuts, rubber and containers for packaging.  She hopes to use her profits from her business to save for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase bags of groundnuts, rubber and containers for packaging.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu is a food vendor in Hohoe. Ramatu has received a basic education but was not able to continue because her family didn’t have enough money to continue her schooling.  

She is married and has three children. Her husband is a cloth designer.  Ramatu has been cooking and selling rice for four years.  She is responsible for feeding her family and meeting their needs.

Her loan will be used to buy gallons of oil, tin tomatoes, and bags of rice directly from the farmers so she can make more profit.  She hopes to save the new profits to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy gallons of oil, tin tomatoes, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 24, is single and a very hard worker man from Jenin.  He is a taxi driver and he and also studies Physical Education at a local university. 

Ahmad seeks a loan from FATEN to pay his university fees. He is determined to complete his studies and find a better job.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 39 years old married man from Jenin.  He is a father for three young sons.  Using a small truck, Muhammad transfers products for traders.  He works very hard to provide for all of his family's needs. 

He dreams of buying a bigger truck in the future so he can increase his income. 

Muhammad now needs some money to pay the license fees for his truck.  He seeks a loan from FATEN.

loans.use: to pay the license fees for his truck.

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem is a married Palestinian man and a father to three sons.  He lives in a small village near Tulkarem called Attel. 

Naeem owns a small store where he sells fruits and vegetables. His business is profitable but he needs money to make improvements.
 
Naeem seeks a loan from FATEN to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell. so his income will increase.  This will enable him to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a married woman from Jinen.  She lives in a nice home located in the city with her husband and six children; two sons and four daughters. 

Intesar's husband works as a taxi driver and he earns a low wage, that barely covers the family's needs. 

Intesar would like to improve their home by buying new furniture.  Intesar is requesting a $500 loan from FATEN to help cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her home.

loans.name: Manar

texts.en:
Manar is a 36 year old married woman and the mother of two sons.  Her husband is a public sector worker and he earns a low wage, which is not enough to cover all their costs. 

Manar and her husband needs some money to improve their family home.

Manar is requesting a loan from FATEN to cover the cost to improve and fix her home. Taking this loan will enable Manar to enjoy living in her home with her family.

loans.use: to pay the costs of fixing her home.

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en:
Etaf is a 32 years old married woman.  She lives with his husband and four children; two sons and and two daughters. Her husband is a worker with a very low wage. Etaf supports her family by sewing cloths.

For the past 10 years, Etaf has had a sewing workshop.  She sells clothes for her customers, which has been a profitable project, but it does not bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the cost of work.

Etaf is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing an additional sewing machine to provide better quality to her loyal customers.  This will increase sales and improve Etaf's income.

loans.use: to purchasing a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Erdenebulgan

texts.en:
Erdenebulgan, 26, lives with his wife and two children in Kherlen, in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has inherited this house and land from his father. 

He has been working as a serviceman at a private business since 2006.  Currently, his wife stays at home and looks after their children. The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair, especially changing its windows which is quite vulnerable to snow storms and strong winds. 

He is requesting a loan of 1500000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, foams, bricks and planks as well as vacuum insulated windows.  Using these materials and replacing house windows with vacuum insulated windows will make the house a warm and comfortable place. 

It will also enable the family to burn less coal and reduce air pollution.  Erdenebulgan is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for his home.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 25 years old. She lives in Bolnisi District with her parents, brother and an infant daughter. Her mother is a teacher at local school and gets a monthly income. Nino requested loan from local financial institutions several times start up a family business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf; the cow's milk is used to produce cheese. Besides, the family owns a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown seasonally. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nino requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved as a part of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program seeks to provide business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Nino will begin a clothing business. She plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers and then resell them at higher price. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin a clothing business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
This loan will help Robert expand his dry cleaning business.

Robert has been in the dry cleaning industry for over 28 years. Robert began his current dry cleaning company 11 years ago with his former business partner. In 2010, Robert assumed full ownership of the business and now successfully manages two locations: one in Pittsburgh and the other in McKees Rocks, PA. His company currently has 12 employees and offers full service dry cleaning, suede and leather cleaning, sewing alterations and shoe repair. 

Robert is looking to further expand his business and needs a loan to purchase additional machines in order to increase production and sign more wholesale accounts.

loans.use: To purchase additional laundry machines

loans.name: Parid

texts.en:
Parid, 21, lives in Marneuli District with his sister, parents, and grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Parid requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. His loan request was always rejected because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly income of his mother, working at the local municipality, and his grandmother’s monthly pension. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Parid requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. These rural poor do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit received, Parid will purchase a stock of groceries to open a grocery store. He has a commercial space where he plans to open the store. With this new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, Parid will be able to increase the income of his family and it will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of groceries and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine, 42, lives in Khashuri District with her husband, two sons, daughter-in-law, and infant daughter. Irine requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions.

Irina has a local grocery store. Besides this, her husband works as a musician at a local restaurant. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Irine has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit received, Irine will purchase a stock of groceries for her grocery store. After the stock is purchased, she will be able to offer her clients more variety of products, which will increase the sales and income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries for her grocery store.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
This loan will help Raymond expand his marketing in order to grow his law firm.

After earning his Bachelor’s Degree from the University of Florida and his law degree from St. Thomas University, Raymond began his law career working to help homeowners with foreclosures and to represent real estate investors as well as homeowner and condominium associations. Raymond opened his own firm specializing in property rights lawsuits in March 2008. He currently has one assistant.

You can view Raymond’s website at http://carrerolegal.com/

Raymond is now looking to expand his services through better marketing and he needs a loan to purchase advertising materials and restructure his website in order to drive more traffic to his business. Raymond hopes this increase in publicity will allow him to expand his firm and hire more employees to help with job creation in the Miami community.

loans.use: To restructure his website and purchase marketing materials

loans.name: Sukhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Sukhbaatar, 42, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house which was built in 2012. Mr. Sukhbaatar has been running a transportation business on a two year contract with a transportation entity. He uses his own minivan and his wife executes the role of conductor.

The house Mr. Sukhbaatar and his family live in has vulnerable external windows, walls and doors. As a result, the house becomes very cold during the winter time and chills the family down to their cores. Mr. Sukhbaatar is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement, planks, and fiberglass. Using those materials, he can renovate his house and will live in a comfortable, warm place. More importantly, the family will burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

Mr. Sukhbaatar is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as bricks, cement and planks.

loans.name: Shepik

texts.en:
Shepik, 54, lives in the small village of Khelvachauri district with husband, Guram, two children, and two grandchildren. Shepik requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from trading clothing. Shepik purchases clothing from wholesalers and then resells them at a higher price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Shepik has requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. This population do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Shepik will purchase a car. After purchasing the car, her husband Guram will be able to serve local people as a taxi driver and thus increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to work as a taxi driver.

loans.name: Enkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhsaikhan, 35, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Her husband raises livestock and currently they have seven cows which are nearly ready to give birth. During this time of year, the price of milk reaches a peak, so nowadays her husband is working hard. She herself has been working as a nurse at the hospital for ten consecutive years and this year she was awarded the golden nurse medal by the medical association.

The house Mrs. Enkhsaikhan and her family live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam, planks, and bricks. Using those materials, she and her husband will make a house extension and insulate and repair the house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and will thus help the efforts against air pollution by emitting less smoke. The borrower, together with her husband, is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, bricks, and planks.

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhtsetseg, 55 years old, lives with her husband in Kherlen, an eastern town in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. All of her children live separately from their parents. She has been working at a private business entity since 2005. Using her previous loan, she has finished her house building but due to the lack of finances, she hasn't fully insulated the walls. So, she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation materials such as fiberglass, foam and cotton. After using those materials for insulation, she and her husband can live in a comfortable and warm place. Moreover, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials such as fiberglass, cotton and foam

loans.name: Gulsin

texts.en: Gulsin is married and has three children. She always wanted to provide them with a good education. Since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life.  Gulsin decided to start a new animal husbandry business in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and gained skills in the business.  Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Tet Trankil De Saillants Group

texts.fr:
Marc habite dans la ville de Trou-du-Nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Marc a dirigé son business pendant les 8 dernières années. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat du charbon.

Marc espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Il est pas marié il a 5 enfants. Marc est le coordinateur de son groupe Tet Trankil de Saillant. Des autres membres de Marc ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. Marc dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant . Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les materiels.
texts.en:
Marc lives in the town of Trou-du-Nord in Haiti where electricity is scarce and water very limited. Marc has been managing his business for the last eight years. He would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of charcoal.

Marc hopes that this loan will help him expand his business. He is unmarried and has five children. He is the coordinator of his group Tet Trankil of Saillant. The other members of Marc’s group need loans for such retail activity as the sale of charcoal, rice and fish. Marc says that his biggest challenge is the lack of steady customers. 

He says his main goal is the growth of his business. His dream is to buy a motorcycle to transport supplies.

loans.use: to buy wood charcoal

loans.name: Les Refferances De Bordemer Group

texts.fr:
Bazile est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Refferances de Bordemer 4, 5 & 6. Il est un commercant et habite dans la région DE BOR DE MER où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Bazile voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans les divers produit. Il va acheter des chaussures, vêtements, cosmétiques, etc.

Bazile espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business les Produit Divers. Des autres membres militant ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, cosmetiques, chaussures, etc. Bazile dit que les défis principal c'est devenus une grande commerçante. Bazile dit que son but principal et son rêve c'est possède un gros business avec son fond et par la grâce de Dieu.
texts.en:
Bazile is the coordinator of his group called Les Refferances de Bordemer 4, 5 & 6. He is a retailer and lives in the area of Bor de Mer where electricity is scarce and water very limited. Bazile would like to use this loan to invest in various items. He will buy shoes, clothing, cosmetics etc.

Bazile hopes that this loan will help him expand his business “Les Produits Divers”. Other members of the group need a loan for retail activities such as charcoal, cosmetics, shoes etc. 

Bazile says the main challenge is to become a large retailer. Hi main goal and his dream is to own a large business with his own money and by the grace of God.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gatiba

texts.en:
Gatiba is married. She is 54 years old. She lives with her three children who are 23, 21 and 10 years old. The youngest is a schoolboy. To provide decent support for her children, Gatiba's husband decided to go abroad to earn extra income. He is engaged in trading in the Russia Kaluga area and each month he sends money to his family. Now she cares for their children by herself.
 
For more than 22 years, she has been earning money by raising livestock. She started this business together with her husband. Today she raises livestock with the help of her son, and sells milk products and cattle for meat purposes. 

Gatiba is taking out a loan for the purchase of materials to build a new stable in order to increase her livestock headcount. She thanks everyone who supports her, as this business is her main source of income.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a new stable.

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is 44 years old. He lives in the Ambrolauri District with his mother and three children who go to school. Goderdzi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have a vineyard and sell wine locally. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Goderdzi requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Goderdzi will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, he will grow cucumbers and tomatoes there to sell at local markets. He will be able to increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 49 years old. He lives in the Rustavi District with his 48-year-old wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren (7 and 3 years old).  Tamaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
 
Tamaz was trading scrap with his mini-bus. He was going to the Kvemo Kartli region to collect scrap from the locals and was bringing it to Rustavi scrap resellers. Tamaz was earning a very small monthly income, which was not enough to feed his big family.

Tamaz requested a loan from Credo to re-startup the family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Tamaz will purchase a mini-bus as his old one broke down and he has to sell it as scrap. After purchasing the new mini-bus, he will be able to continue working in the same business, where he is already very experienced. He needs the loan desperately as his mini-bus was the only source of income for the family.  With the re started business, Tamaz will try to work harder and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a mini-bus

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 53 years old. He lives in a small village in Kharagauli District with his wife, son and father, who receives a retirement pension. Avtandil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business startup, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from a bakery, where Georgian national "Khachapuri" (cheese in bread) is made and sold. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Avtandil requested a loan from Credo to startup a family business. His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business startup and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Avtandil will purchase special apparatus for producing different kinds of baked goods, which will enable him to offer more assortments to his clients. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Startup loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase special apparatus for producing different kinds of baked goods

loans.name: Tusonge Mbele Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukubanya est trésorière et doyenne du groupe d’affaire Tusonge Mbele,  entrepreneur, âgée de 67 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui ont déjà leurs propres foyers.  Son fils cadet est un universitaire  et  fait la deuxième de graduat.   La cliente est vendeuse des boissons sucrées (Fanta, Coca, etc.). Elle commença cette affaire vers les années 1980 avec son fonds propre.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 25 casiers de boissons sucrées.  Les casses de bouteilles constituent une lourde perte pour son activité.  Elle souhaite réfectionner sa maison  d’habitation et passer le reste de sa vie en paix avec ses enfants et petits fils. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit. . Il sied de signaler que la photo fut prise à un endroit encombrant, dans un bidonville, d’où certaines figures non visible.
texts.en: The client named Mukubanya is the treasurer and the elder of the Tusonge Mbele business group. She is a 67 year old businesswoman, a widow and has seven children who have their own homes. Her youngest son is at university doing his second year before graduating. The client sells sugary drinks (Fanta, Coca, etc.)  She started this business in the 1980s with her own money. This new loan will enable her to purchase 25 crates of sweet drinks. Broken bottles are a source of financial loss for her activity. She would like to repair her home and spend the rest of her days with her children and her grandchildren. Finally, she thanks Hekima very much for their micro-credit support. It should be noted that the photo was taken in an awkward place in the slums so some of the faces are not visible.

loans.use: to buy 25 crates of sweet drinks.

loans.name: Arnak

texts.en:
Arnak started his farm business many years ago. He cultivates onions and sunflowers and has his own truck, which he uses to take the gathered harvest to the nearby city to sell in the market.
 
Arnak sustains his family of three: his wife and two little sons. As the agricultural business is the main source of income for Arnak, it is very important for him to expand it.
 
He has applied for this loan to pay for fuel for taking the gathered harvest to the market and to purchase fertilizer and onion seeds. This will help Arnak to expand his agricultural activity and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and purchase fertilizer and onion seeds

loans.name: Philippe

texts.fr:
Philippe  fait partie du groupe Bikorwavyimana  et est un des victimes de  l’incendie du marché central de Bujumbura. Il est client  de Turame depuis 2007. Il  habite à  Bujumbura. Il est célibataire.

Il  faisait le commerce des habits (essuie-mains, draps, nappes, couvre-lits) au marché central de Bujumbura. Il a perdu des marchandises d’une valeur de 5000000(3205,18 $).
Il voudrait  évoluer vers le commerce d’importation  et il préparait son  mariage. Ces projets sont arrêtés.

Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  reconstituer son capital en achetant des habits (essuie-mains, nappes, couvre-lits,…) à revendre pour continuer de gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Philippe is part of the group Bikorwavyimana and is one of the victims of the fire of the central market in Bujumbura. He has been a client of Turame since 2007. He lives in Bujumbura. He is single.

He sold clothes (hand towels, sheets, tablecloths, bedcovers) in the central market of Bujumbura. He lost merchandise valued at 5,000,000 ($3,205.18).

He would like to develop towards imports and he was preparing his marriage. These projects are stopped.

With the Kiva loan that he receives, he is going to reconstitute his capital by buying clothes (hand towels, tablecloths, bedspreads...) to resell to continue to make a living.

loans.use: to reconstitute his capital by buying hand towels, tablecloths and bedspreads to resell.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen vive en la linda ciudad de Pisco, conocida por sus lindas playas sus atractivos turísticos como las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de Paracas, asimismo se desarrolla la pesca y la agricultura , en especial el cultivo de algodón,. Maíz, entre otros. Carmen vive al lado de su esposo y juntos tienen un pequeño de 5 años de edad, el cual es su motivo de salir adelante cada día y dar lo mejor de si para demostrarle que con trabajo y honradez se puede lograr salir adelante. Ella es una madre muy amorosa y le gusta preparar postres en sus tiempos libres ya que tiene muy buena sazón para ello y también aprovecha en algunas oportunidades para poder cocinar uno de sus platos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres Carmen solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de enfermería.

Carmen trabaja desde hace 3 años y con mucho ahorro logro iniciar su negocio de venta de calzado con el cual apoya puede aportar a su hogar y puede solventar junto a su esposo a su familia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes, ofrece productos de calidad y sobre todo es muy conocida y por ellos clientes siempre regresan. 

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su valioso apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar zapatos por temporada de verano y  con ello podrá tener mayor variedad de modelos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos; así de esta manera podrá seguir creciendo y seguir dándole muchas ganas a su trabajo para poder conseguir cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena profesión a sus hijos y crecer aun mas en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the beautiful city of Pisco. It is known for its beautiful beaches and tourist attractions such as the Islas Ballestas and the Paracas Candelabra. There is also fishing and agriculture, especially cotton and corn, among others. Carmen lives with her husband and together they have a 5 year old child. He is her reason for getting ahead and giving the best of herself to show him that with hard work and honesty one can get ahead. She is a very loving mother and she likes to make desserts in her free time, since she is a good cook. She also likes to cook one of her favorite dishes, which is  the delicious “arroz con pato” [duck and rice]. Due her parents'  lack of resources, Carmen only went to secondary school, but she would have liked to study nursing.

Carmen has worked for 3 years and now she has been able to start her business selling shoes to support her home. With her husband, she is able to pay the family expenses She believes that it is going well for her because she is friendly to the customers, she offers quality products and above all, she is well known and her customers always come back.   

Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since this is the second time they have offered their valuable help. At this time, she will be able to buy shoes for the summer season and thus have a wider variety of styles to offer her customers and improve her income. This way, she can keep growing and putting her efforts into her work to be able to achieve her biggest dream: "give her son a good education and grow even more in her business."

loans.use: to buy summer shoes

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha,  ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy alegres y tienen un don especial para la preparación de platillos, asimismo la ciudad de chincha es la cuna de grande s glorias del deporte peruano y sobre todo se baila uno de los bailes típicos de nuestro país el cual es el festejo. Carmen es madre de 4 hijos, los  cuales actualmente son mayores de edad, pero por quienes siempre ha luchado para poder darles una vida digna y sobre todo con ejemplo de trabajo y amor. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión y en ocasiones le encanta preparar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pato con causa rellena”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar secretario.

Día a día Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de colado, el cual es un dulce muy rico que puede comerse acompañado de pan o comerse solo, también ofrece sándwich y champú, que también es un dulce típico de nuestro país,  Rosa trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha experiencia y porque tiene una buena sazón.

Carmen está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como taper plásticos para poder vender sus productos, así como insumos como frejol, chanchaca, ajonjolí al por mayor, entre otros; de esta manera ella podrá poder ofrecer de mejor manera sus productos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder construir su vivienda ya que se derrumbo por el terremoto del año 2007”.
texts.en:
Carmen is 55-years-old, she lives in the city of Chincha, a city which is characterized by its warm and welcoming climate. Its inhabitants are also very happy people who have a special gift in preparing dishes. The city of Chincha is the birthplace of major Peruvian sporting athletes and above all, it is where one of the traditional dances of our country, the Festejo, is danced. Carmen is mother to four children, who are now all adults, but for whom she has always fought to given them a dignified life and in particular, a true example of hard work and love. Rosa is a very hardworking woman, but when she has a bit of free time, she very much likes watching television and on occasions, she loves preparing one of her favorite dishes which is the delicious “Arroz con Pato con causa rellena”. Given her minimal financial resources, she could only complete up to the 4th year of secondary school, but she would have liked to study to be a secretary.

From day to day, Rosa works in her small business selling colado (a traditional bean dessert), which is a very delicious sweet that can be eaten with bread or eaten alone. She also sells sandwiches and drinks called champús which is also a typical sweet in our country. Rosa works around 10 hours a day in her business, she believes that it the business is going well for her because she has a lot of experience and because she has an excellent sense of taste.
